Are you passionate about agile software development, excited by end-to-end responsibility, and looking for a pleasant work atmosphere with plenty of room for growth? Welcome to Breuninger!

In our technology, we believe in "you build it, you run it" and operate our verticalized multichannel platform on AWS. Our teams are responsible for the software architecture themselves. With us, you work cloud-native and are both a hacker and a team player.

Freedom and opportunities for creativity allow you to realize your potential in an agile and trusting environment. We foster transparent, open, and close collaboration with business units, product owners, management, and DevOps teams. - As an experienced member of our development teams, you will design, plan, and develop complex features for our Flutter-based app with a particular focus on the iOS platform.  
- In our modern cross-platform architecture, you will actively take ownership of your code, drive technical decisions, and set new standards for quality and performance.  
- You will shape the entire development process from architecture to deployment and ensure high-quality, high-performance implementations through your Flutter and iOS expertise.

- With your experience, you will estimate and evaluate the effort of complex features, taking into account technical requirements and business impact—always maintaining a balance between technical excellence and economic value.

- You have a deep understanding of iOS UI/UX guidelines and can successfully transfer them to Flutter projects.  
- Your strong communication skills and problem-solving abilities make you a valuable team player.  
- You enjoy sharing your Flutter and iOS expertise with others and advancing your team members' development through mentoring, code reviews, and workshops.  
- You proactively take responsibility for your projects and can empathize well with the needs of end users.  
- You are experienced in agile development methods (Scrum, Kanban) and have experience with open-source technologies in the mobile environment.  

**Additional Information**

At System Management, passion and profession go hand in hand.

Le département Rossel Applications a pou:
**English Translation:**

The Rossel Applications department is responsible for overseeing and managing all tasks related to the design, implementation, integration, and evolution of the various application environments of the Rossel Group (digital, advertising, editorial content, marketing, finance, HR, customer support, subscription management, sales and distribution, etc.).

Based on functional needs and corporate strategy, the various teams—composed of Project Managers, technical architects, full-stack developers, web front-end or mobile developers—work hand in hand with business teams to deliver the most innovative and suitable technological solutions to meet the challenges of the various publishers and companies within the Group (Le Soir, La Voix Du Nord, Sudinfo, Rossel Advertising, Rossel Est Media, RTL, Mediafin, Metro, Ciné Télé Revue, etc.).

**Mission**

As part of the Rossel Mobile Factory, the Android developer is responsible for handling development requests for the various mobile applications of the Rossel Group (Le Soir, La Voix Du Nord, RTL, Ciné Télé Revue, Metro, Paris-Normandie, etc.).

Under the responsibility of the Product Owner and the Mobile Tech Lead, and based on an Agile approach and the SCRUM methodology, the developer will actively participate in the following tasks:

- Analyze business requests, provide feasibility feedback, estimate user stories, and contribute to building the product backlog.
- Create prototypes and mockups to facilitate the evaluation and validation of UI and UX considerations.
- Over two-week iterations on average, handle the development and deployment of work aimed at continuously enriching the product and delivering an increment that adds value.
- Collaborate with other mobile developers on both platforms (iOS and Android), testers, designers, POs, and external partners.
- Ensure the implementation and maintenance of a sustainable and open application architecture that promotes component reuse and their exposure (internally and externally).
- Participate in daily scrum meetings and other technical meetings related to mobile applications.
- Analyze crash reports and propose solutions.
- Participate in various testing phases (unit, functional, integration, acceptance, automated).
- Create and maintain technical documentation.
- Write clear and maintainable code.
- Stay up to date with technical advancements and integrate the latest Android-specific technologies.
- Propose application improvements and value-added services.

**What We Are Looking For**

Holder of a Bachelor's, Master's degree in Computer Science, or an engineering degree in IT, you have at least 3 years of experience in Android mobile development.

- Curious, enjoys teamwork, and sharing knowledge.
- Strong knowledge of the Kotlin language.
- Experience with the MVVM design pattern.
- Knowledge of object-oriented programming.
- Familiarity with the principles of Clean Architecture.
- Proficiency in Android Architecture Components (AAC).
- Experience with Kotlin Flow.
- Experience with Kotlin Coroutines.
- Writing unit tests.
- Writing UI tests.
- Knowledge of production deployment on stores (Google Play Console).
- Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodology.
- Experience with libraries such as Dagger, Koin, Kodein, Retrofit.
- CI/CD: Experience with a continuous integration and distribution system.
- Knowledge of application modularization.
- Development of new features while adhering to best practices and Android guidelines.
- Knowledge of obfuscation using Proguard/Dexguard.
- Solution-oriented, capable of resolving bugs.
- Knowledge of Gradle.
- Good communication skills.
- Experience with Git and Gitflow and a hosting service (Bitbucket, GitLab, GitHub, Azure DevOps).
- Knowledge of Jetpack Compose.

**Bonus**

- Implementation and integration of advertising solutions in mobile apps.
- Knowledge of KMP/KMM (Kotlin Multiplatform Mobile).

- You have solid experience with GIT.
- You are a true front-end enthusiast: you get excited about a beautiful UI, actively contribute to UX discussions, and strive for a smooth user experience.
- Clean code principles make you happy, and you enjoy contributing to the further development of the app's modular architecture, for which the blueprint is already in place. The code you write is readable and easy to test.
- You are enthusiastic about new Android technologies and features and keep up with them. Testing these and evaluating their usefulness for the app is a challenge you enjoy.
- You have experience with CI/CD.
- You are fluent in Kotlin but can also work with Java.
- You have a solid understanding of MVVM, clean architecture, and asynchronous programming (using Coroutines/Flow).
- **Nice to have:** Knowledge of writing performant Jetpack Compose code and improving it using Baseline Profiles and Compose Performance Inspection.
- **Nice to have:** Knowledge of the following tools & libraries: Gradle build system, Jetpack libraries (ViewModel, (Compose) Navigation, WorkManager, etc.), Retrofit, Room, Koin DI.
- **Nice to have:** Knowledge of Kotlin Multiplatform.
- **Nice to have:** Experience with non-Android tools such as Figma, Bitrise, Lokalise, Firebase, Jira & Confluence.
- You are fluent in Dutch and proficient in English & French.

**What do we offer you?**
You will join a hardworking team where communication and team spirit are key. With flexible working hours and a fantastic office atmosphere, we hope to offer you your new dream job. Of course, there is also the option to work from home, though you definitely won’t want to miss our 'Last Thursday' drinks! Additionally, you’ll receive unlimited access to 4411 services. Do we need to say more?

**Interested?**
Are you still excited after reading this description, or would you like to schedule an introductory meeting? Apply via the button below, and who knows, you might soon be working on the largest parking application in Belgium!

S čím nám můžeš pomoci\r\n\r\nV současno:
**What You Can Help Us With**

We are currently working on entirely new projects for the general public. At the same time, we are preparing updates for our existing applications for our long-term partners.

If you're interested in challenges in the field of Android development, you'll have the opportunity here. You'll be involved in the development of applications ranging from e-bikes, loyalty apps, storage boxes, to payment terminals and code scanners for warehouse systems.

We always focus on design, prepared analytics, architecture, and functionality. Are you in?
Jak vypadá náš IT tým?\r\n\r\nNových tec:
**What does our IT team look like?**

We are not afraid of new technologies and strive to keep up with the latest versions. On Android, we build applications exclusively using Jetpack Compose, while on iOS, we are gradually transitioning to SwiftUI. Part of our work also includes regular time for refactoring and reducing technical debt, which helps us maintain high code and application quality.

**What are we currently working on?**

Together, we are developing our e-shop mobile application, which is not just a poor sibling to the web solution. It is used by a significant percentage of our customers. The average rating of 4.8 and over 50,000 reviews across both platforms speak for themselves.

We were the first in the Czech Republic to implement Apple Pay and allow our customers to track Pilulka Auto during delivery, similar to tracking a taxi when ordering an Uber. Paying with Bitcoin is also a given with us.

What other technological innovation will we come up with together?

Additionally, we have developers working on the development of our e-shop solution, internal back-office system (CRM, ERP), business intelligence, and vendor management system, primarily using PHP, JS, Python, and GoLang.

**What do we expect from you - iOS?**
- At least 2 years of experience in developing mobile applications for iOS
- Excellent knowledge of the Swift programming language and XCode
- You feel at home when working with UITableViews and UICollectionViews
- Knowledge of SwiftUI is an advantage

The most important things for us are analytical thinking, a willingness to learn new things, and enthusiasm for work.

**What do we expect from you - Android?**
- At least 2 years of experience in developing mobile applications for Android
- Excellent knowledge of Kotlin
- Excellent knowledge of Android SDK
- Good knowledge of Kotlin Flow
- Good knowledge of Kotlin Coroutines
- Good knowledge of MVVM architecture
- Knowledge of Jetpack Compose is an advantage

The most important things for us are analytical thinking, a willingness to learn new things, and enthusiasm for work.

**What else can we offer you?**
- The possibility of partial remote work with occasional trips to the office; for us, the quality of work matters, not clocking in and out
- An informal company culture
- We value transparency, honesty, humanity, and quick, effective solutions. You can share your opinion openly with anyone in the company
- Foreign language lessons - English, German, Spanish? :)
- Contribution to a Multisport card
- Offices just a few minutes' walk from the Palmovka or Českomoravská metro stations
- Dog-friendly office
- Every Tuesday, we prepare a bunch of fruit for breakfast
- Company events (mountains, water sports, cultural activities, running races, and many other experiences) as well as IT team-building activities. Most recently, we visited the Trautenberk brewery and climbed Sněžka
- Discounts on products from our range
- We care about a well-balanced work-life balance because it’s a win-win for both sides

If you want to join us, get in touch or send us your LinkedIn profile.

We look forward to hearing from you :)

Senior Mobile Developerin roolista Nitor:
**Senior Mobile Developer Role at Nitor**

In mobile development, our primary platforms are iOS and Android. We develop both native applications using Swift, Objective-C, and Kotlin, as well as cross-platform solutions with React Native. You’ll also have the opportunity to work with the latest technologies, such as SwiftUI and Jetpack Compose.

A solid foundation is the basis upon which a high-quality application is built. That’s why we always strive to use the best possible and modern architectural solutions, such as reactive programming, unidirectional data flow, MVVM, and clean architecture. We develop extensive and long-term applications, so in this role, you’ll take responsibility for maintaining and improving the quality of applications over the long term.

The duration of our mobile projects typically ranges from one year to several years, depending on your preferences. In most projects, you’ll work as part of the client’s development team, which often includes several other experienced Nitor developers.

---

### ✅ What is needed to succeed as a Mobile Developer at Nitor?
- Our mobile projects are typically complex, requiring good time management and a solid understanding of software development principles. For example, you understand why singletons are bad and why dependency injection is good. Asynchronous programming is familiar to you.
- Several years of experience in software development across various services/products, enabling you to bring added value as an expert in client projects. Our clients often expect close to ten years of relevant experience.
- You’ve written unit tests and perhaps some integration tests as well. An interest in cloud environments, such as AWS and Firebase, is considered an advantage.
- You’re familiar with cross-platform frameworks that enable application development for different devices, and you understand the importance of agile quality assurance practices in mobile development.
- We value a passionate approach to producing high-quality code, writing tests, and the ability to adopt new, relevant technologies.
- The ability to work agilely to achieve team goals in a client-focused environment is important to us. Therefore, we value strong teamwork skills as well as a consultative and client-oriented mindset. Fluency in Finnish and English is required.

---

### Why Nitor?
In addition to meaningful projects and tailored professional development opportunities, we offer you a benefits package that truly makes a difference. Nitor is built to support your career growth, sustainable work pace, and overall well-being. Here are some examples of our benefits:

- You can use 10% of your working hours for your own professional development, supported by the company.
- Want to attend an interesting event in your field? You can use five workdays per year for training or conference trips anywhere in the world.
- You have access to a €7,100 “Hardware Bank” for work equipment and home office purchases, which replenishes monthly.
- Full vacation entitlement from the start of your employment, regardless of the time of year you begin.
- Comprehensive cultural and sports benefits, massage benefits, as well as commuting and bicycle benefits.
- A bonus of €500–€2,000 for each certification you complete.
- A very extensive occupational health package and health insurance, covering specialized medical care, dental services, and mental health support.
- We foster community through annual trips (we’ve been to Pisa, Berlin, Vienna, Edinburgh, Dubrovnik, and northern ski resorts), seasonal events, and weekly gatherings and breakfasts. Join us for running club, wine tastings, movie nights, HIIT workouts, or board game sessions!
- Our approach is based on trust, openness, and mutual respect; every Nitorian contributes to the company’s operations. We value and embrace diversity and the added value it brings to our clients.

---

### About Your Future Employer

Nitor is a digital engineering company founded in 2007, employing around 300 builders of future business. Every Nitorian is a digital engineer: a pragmatic and solution-oriented team player who doesn’t settle for assumptions. We are characterized by exceptionally high professionalism and pride in our own work as well as that of our colleagues. We work with some of the largest Finnish companies, helping them succeed in building a better digital world.

Our growth is on a solid foundation: our revenue has grown every year, and in 2023, we achieved our 17th consecutive year of growth, reaching €40 million in revenue. Once again in 2023, we were ranked first in IT industry customer satisfaction in Onway’s comparison for the 12th consecutive year. Additionally, our internal employee surveys consistently show very high satisfaction with Nitor as an employer. As recognition of our excellent employee experience, we were awarded the title of Finland’s most attractive employer brand in 2023. At Nitor, there’s no middle management, micromanagement, or repetitive, low-impact client projects. You can trust that you’ll be able to focus entirely on your project while we take care of everything else.

At Nitor, an open company culture and transparency are an essential part of our daily life. One of our core values is community. Our approach is based on trust, openness, and mutual respect. Every Nitorian brings their own unique flavor to the company and community. We value and embrace diversity and the added value it brings—no one is forced into a specific mold here.

---

### Sound promising?  
Send us your LinkedIn profile or CV, and let’s discuss what Nitor could offer you.

---

### Nitor’s Recruitment Process

Our recruitment process reflects our values—it’s a clear and transparent four-step dialogue during which you’ll meet at least four Nitorians. We’ll provide you with all the information you need to make a decision about your next workplace.

1. **Getting to know Nitor**: We’ll explore your key career aspirations. Our People Partner will tell you about Nitor, our projects, and what your work at Nitor could look like.
2. **Technical interview**: You’ll meet two of our mobile developers, who will assess the strengths and breadth of your technical expertise. You’ll also get firsthand information about our projects and Nitor as an employer.
3. **Open questions**: We’ll double-check that all your questions have been answered. We’ll clarify your future role at Nitor and lay the groundwork for your upcoming job offer.
4. **Offer presentation**: We’ll present the offer either at our office or in an online meeting, where you can immediately ask for additional details about the offer.

Does this sound promising? Would you like to be part of enabling the “eternal warranty” we promise our clients? Send us your LinkedIn profile or CV, and let’s discuss what Nitor could offer you.

At Sephora we inspire our customers, emp:
At Sephora, we inspire our customers, empower our teams, and help them become the best versions of themselves. We create an environment where people are valued, and differences are celebrated. Every day, our teams around the world bring our purpose to life: to change the way the world sees beauty by revealing the extraordinary in each of us.

We are united by a common goal: to reimagine the future of beauty.

You will excel and thrive in this position if you are ready to:
• Participate in the development of new features for Android applications across various countries.
• Maintain the existing foundation (code optimization, bug fixes, production incident interventions).
• Perform unit testing and work closely with Test Analysts to ensure the technical viability of developed systems and solutions.
• Conduct technological research and propose technical topics aimed at improving app performance.
• Write technical documentation on Confluence.
• Participate in workload estimation exercises and commit with the rest of the team to delivering a functional scope in each iteration.
• Report blocking issues to Leads Dev/Scrum Master.
• Mentor junior developers in skill development and best practices.
• Continuously evolve best development practices and promote the culture and implementation of DevOps within the team.

Don’t hesitate to apply if you have the following skills:
• Proficiency in Kotlin and Java programming languages.
• Knowledge of object-oriented programming and advanced concepts like Generics and Lambda expressions.
• Deep understanding of the lifecycle of different Android instances and activities.
• Mastery of Clean Architecture (Repository, Services, Mappers, LiveData, etc.) and the MVVM design pattern.
• Expertise in reactive programming (Coroutines, RXJava/RxKotlin).
• Experience with dependency injection (Koin, Dagger, etc.).
• Proficiency in unit testing (PowerMock, EasyMock, Mockito, Robolectric, etc.).
• Familiarity with code debugging tools.
• Experience with Git, Postman, JIRA, and Confluence.
• Knowledge of the Agile SCRUM framework.

And if you are:
• A graduate with a bachelor’s degree or equivalent in engineering (BAC+5) with at least 5 years of experience as an Android developer.
• A good communicator in both French and English.
• Attentive and capable of understanding the technical and functional aspects of projects, as well as business objectives and priorities.
• Dedicated to product quality and safety.
• Rigorous, passionate, committed, and responsible for your deliverables.
• A mentor who can simplify complex concepts and act as a bridge between technical and business stakeholders.

At Sephora, you’ll enjoy…

• The people. You will be surrounded by talented teams you’ll be proud to collaborate with.
• The learning. We invest in training and developing our teams. You will continue to grow and build your skills through personalized career plans.
• The culture. As a leader in the selective distribution of prestige beauty products within the LVMH family, our impact is global. Innovation is in our DNA, and at Sephora, all 40,000 employees across 35 markets and 3,000 stores are united by a common goal: to reimagine the future of beauty.

You can unleash your creativity because we have a disruptive spirit. You can learn and grow because we empower you to be your best. You can be yourself because you are what makes us unique. This is the future of beauty. Reimagine your future at Sephora.

Sephora is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, or career development.

We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating and fostering an inclusive environment for all.
Prêt à vous déployer ? ✨ Alors bienvenue:
**Ready to take off? ✨ Welcome to Rakuten France! Here's what we offer you:**

- Exciting projects  
- Growth and opportunities  
- The joy of getting up in the morning  
- Management that helps you grow  
- A large-scale company with a human touch  

If you identify with our values, join the Apps team as an **Android Developer**!

---

### **About the Tech Team:**

Our Development team is responsible for implementing new features for our website, its mobile version, and mobile applications, combining both Backend and Frontend development. The team places great importance on technical expertise and knowledge sharing: our engineers collaborate and share ideas through internal technical conferences and cross-functional topics.  

The team is organized into 12 feature teams (2 tribes), each focusing on a specific area of the application. Every team consists of a Tech Lead, Developers, a Product Owner, and a QA, forming the "tri-amigos."

---

### **About the Apps Feature Team:**

The Apps team, responsible for developing Rakuten France's native iOS and Android applications, operates using the agile SCRUM methodology. The team includes a Product Owner, a Technical Lead, a Lead Android Developer, Developers, and two QA specialists.  

Additionally, you’ll be part of a global technical team with diverse expertise, where members challenge and share knowledge with one another, attend internal technical conferences, and explore cross-functional topics.  

The Apps team provides our mobile users with most of the features of our marketplace, such as listings, search, checkout (payment methods, etc.), loyalty club features, ad posting, and much more!

---

### **Your Responsibilities:**

- Be involved in all project phases, from design to production.  
- Participate in the technical design of projects and propose technologies for development.  
- Contribute to project estimations to build the roadmap and assist the Product Owner in creating a realistic roadmap.  
- Develop prioritized stories with a high level of quality (unit tests/integration tests/BDD).  
- Ensure code quality: participate in testing and project documentation, and strive to delight our users with new features.  
- Stay curious and proactive about new technologies and improvements. Regular tech monitoring will allow you to shine during our TechWeeks.  
- Collaborate with other development teams to ensure a consistent user experience across platforms.  

---

### **Your Profile:**

- Engineering degree (Bac+5) with solid experience in Android development (minimum 3 years).  
- Proactive, curious, and passionate about innovative technologies, which you’ll explore and analyze during TechWeeks and conventions like Android Makers.  
- Enjoy discussing ideas with peers and staying up-to-date on the latest technologies and trends.  
- Proficiency in English is essential for documentation and pull requests.  
- Autonomous yet a team player, organized, and detail-oriented.  

---

### **Technical Environment:**

- **Android Framework**  
- **Kotlin / RxJava & Coroutines / Flow**  
- **RESTful APIs**  
- **Room Database**  
- Patterns: **MVVM / Repository**  
- **Git (GitHub / Gitflow) / Jira / Firebase**  
- Continuous Integration: **GitHub Actions**  

**Methodologies:** Agile / Scrum / Kanban  

**Bonus Skills:**  
- Clean Architecture  
- Jetpack Compose  

---

### **Benefits at Rakuten:**

- Flexible remote work policy, including an annual allowance  
- Beautiful offices in the heart of Paris (Sentier)  
- Edenred meal card for lunch expenses  
- 50% coverage of transportation costs  
- 50% coverage of health insurance by Rakuten  
- 12 additional paid leave days (RTT) on top of 25 vacation days  
- Year-round team-building and social events  
- Attractive Rakuten Group stock options program  
- Multicultural and international teams  

---

If you see yourself in these points and want to join motivated, talented, and supportive teams, then you’re the right person! This is your chance to contribute to the evolution of a marketplace that places merchants and members at the heart of its strategy.

---

### **Recruitment Process:**

1. Initial discussion with Céline, Talent Acquisition Manager  
2. Technical test  
3. Meeting with Pauline, Lead Android Developer, and Lionel, iOS Tech Lead  
4. Meeting with the Apps team: Sid-Ali (QA) and Lucas (Product Owner)  

Rakuten France recruits, recognizes, and integrates all talents.

**Company Description**

Free2Move was created to simplify and ensure mobility for everyone!

Founded in 2016, Free2Move now brings together a range of new mobility services to meet the travel needs of its individual customers.

With Free2Move, you can rent a city car for your trip to Italy, find the nearest charging station for your electric vehicle in Europe, book a parking spot for your weekend in Paris... all with just one click on a single digital platform!

We were born from the merger of the PSA Group and the start-up TravelCar, which gives us a mindset of agility and ambition.

In just 6 years, Free2Move has established itself as a key player in revolutionizing traveler mobility.

Now the go-to choice for over 1 million users in more than 62 countries across 5 continents, available in 30 languages and 26 currencies, Free2Move boasts 5,000 partners and hundreds of thousands of vehicles available for rent!

Do you identify with this vision? You’re in the right place!

If you want to join a team of passionate individuals in a human-sized, innovative, agile, and internationally-oriented structure, and be part of a dynamic, fun, motivated, and diverse team of experts whose primary goal is to innovate... don’t wait any longer,

We are looking for real talents to accompany us in the long term, prioritizing the quality of our candidates over the quantity of resources.

---

Working at Free2Move means joining a tribe where excellence and a culture of performance go hand in hand with a great atmosphere, but also:

- Career growth opportunities.

### **About Rakuten:**  
Rakuten is a global leader in online services and the inventor of the B2B2C marketplace model. Founded in 1997 in Japan, Rakuten offers an ecosystem of over 80 complementary digital services across 30 countries, spanning e-commerce, telecommunications, fintech, advertising, and artificial intelligence.  

In France, Rakuten is a pioneer of the collaborative and circular economy. Its inclusive platform allows everyone, from major retailers to small local businesses, to sell their products to a vast community of buyers. Sellers benefit from innovative technological tools and services to grow their business online and in-store, including click & collect.  

Rakuten’s commitment to virtuous e-commerce is reflected in its non-competitive approach, encouraging both businesses and individuals to resell their products, making the platform a key player in the second-hand market.  

Rakuten’s success is built on a dual promise: the power to buy and the power to resell. Today, over 10 million French users benefit from this commitment through Club R. More than just a loyalty program, Club R rewards buyers and sellers while promoting the circular economy.  

True to its founding values, Rakuten advocates for a responsible digital model—for merchants, the environment, and consumers: e-commerce that works for everyone.

L'environnement technique 🔧\r\n• Réécrit:
**The Technical Environment 🔧**  
- Complete rewrite of the production codebase, completed in 2022  
- The stack: 100% Swift/SwiftUI, Combine + async/await, The Composable Architecture (TCA)  
- Non-regression: Unit Tests + Snapshot Testing  
- CI/CD: Fastlane/Bitrise  
- Tooling: Modularization via SPM, formatting via SwiftLint, code generation via SwiftGen & Sourcery  

---

**Job Responsibilities and Activities 🎯**  

**Impact on Delivery**  
- By implementing products and features with the required levels of quality and polish  
- By being involved in the various stages of projects: from design to results analysis  
- By regularly contributing ideas and taking initiative, expressing opinions, and providing feedback  

**Impact on Discovery**  
- By participating in frequent iterations to quickly gather insights into customer behavior  
- By always seeking shortcuts – simpler, faster, and involving fewer people  

**Participate in Production Supervision**  
- By monitoring operational metrics daily  
- Not only on the tech side but also on product and business aspects  

**Contribute to Building the iOS Team**  
- By actively contributing to the definition, adoption, and improvement of processes, methods, tools, and rituals  
- By helping train and challenge junior developers  
- By participating in research and exploration efforts within the iOS ecosystem  

**Contribute to Building the Product Team**  
- By challenging the team on vision, environment, and technical processes  
- By challenging colleagues on other aspects: product, design, growth, etc.

**Company Description**

Digital Virgo Group is among the global specialists in mobile payment through telecom operator billing solutions. By connecting merchants to operators, we address the growing need for payment digitalization using a simple, fast, and secure transactional channel available worldwide.

By joining Digital Virgo, you become part of a high-performing and innovative international group, supported by local, human-scale teams that collaborate daily, leveraging their complementary skills. We all come from diverse backgrounds and experiences, and this diversity is our strength.

Our employees describe the work environment as a perfect mix of good vibes and ambitious projects. We emphasize personal development and encourage initiative-taking.

For more information about our activities and group, visit digitalvirgo.com.

**Job Description**

We are looking for a passionate iOS Developer to join our team dedicated to native applications. As a key member of the team, you will be involved in all stages of the application lifecycle, from analysis to production, including design, development, testing, distribution, and maintenance.

**Your Responsibilities:**

As a developer within the native applications team, you will bring both your technical expertise and collaborative spirit. You will work closely with other team members, share your knowledge and best practices, support your colleagues, and challenge them to contribute to the success of projects. You will also need to demonstrate flexibility to meet current needs.

The following skills are expected:
- **Mastery of architectures:** Contribute to designing robust and high-performing solutions.
- **Critical vision of objectives:** Actively participate in the iterative development of products.
- **Attention to detail:** Identify edge cases to optimize application testing and integration.
- **Technological curiosity:** Stay up-to-date with trends and developments in native development to enrich the team technically.
- **Negotiation skills:** Help manage priorities and coordinate team commitments.
- **Excellent communication skills:** Ensure clear and transparent communication within the team and with stakeholders, ensuring project progress is well-shared. An intermediate level of English is required for daily exchanges with international teams.

**Qualifications**

**Required Qualifications and Skills:**
- **Languages:** Proficiency in French and English (daily written and oral communication with international teams).
- **Experience:** Minimum of 5 years of experience in iOS development.
- **Technical Skills:**
  - Strong foundation in iOS development, mastery of Swift, and ability to read/complete Objective-C code.
  - Experience with UI Kit and SwiftUI.
  - Solid knowledge of RESTful services and network programming.
  - Experience with SQLite and some NoSQL databases (e.g., Realm).
  - Mastery of object-oriented programming (OOP) and use of appropriate design patterns.
  - Ability to learn and adapt to new technologies.

**Bonus Points:**
- Knowledge of streaming and digital rights management (DRM).
- Familiarity with GraphQL protocol and experience with Apollo libraries.
- Agile methodologies.
- UI testing.
- Test-driven development (TDD).
- Knowledge of Fastlane.
- Knowledge of Carthage.
- Knowledge of Android is a plus.

**Additional Information**

**Compensation:** Between €40,000 and €44,000.

**Company Benefits:** Meal vouchers (€9.50/day), profit-sharing, health insurance, employee benefits committee (CSE): reimbursement for sports subscriptions, vacation vouchers, ticketing (movie tickets, cultural vouchers, etc.), internal mobility and referral programs, remote work.

**Recruitment Process**

If your profile catches our interest, you will be invited to a first interview with the Human Resources department, followed by a second interview with the operational managers.

This opportunity is much more than just a job.

At Digital Virgo, we are proud to promote an inclusive and diverse environment.

We all come from different backgrounds and experiences, which is our strength. Our opportunities are open to everyone, regardless of origin, orientation, gender identity, or disability.

Join our diverse and inclusive teams where everyone can thrive and succeed.

**Company Description**  

Free2Move was created to simplify and ensure mobility for everyone!  

Founded in 2016, Free2Move now brings together a range of new mobility services to meet the travel needs of its individual customers.  

With Free2Move, you can rent a city car for your trip to Italy, find the nearest charging station for your electric vehicle in Europe, book a parking spot for your weekend in Paris... all with just one click on a single digital platform!  

We were born from the merger of the PSA Group and the startup TravelCar, which gives us a mindset of agility and ambition.  

In just 6 years, Free2Move has established itself as a key player in revolutionizing traveler mobility.  

Now the go-to choice for over 1 million users in more than 62 countries across 5 continents, available in 30 languages and 26 currencies, Free2Move boasts 5,000 partners and hundreds of thousands of vehicles available for rent!  

Do you identify with this vision? You’re in the right place!  

If you want to join a team of passionate individuals in a human-sized, innovative, agile, and internationally-oriented structure, and be part of a dynamic, fun, motivated, and diverse team of experts whose primary goal is to innovate... don’t wait any longer.  

**JOIN US!**  

---

**Job Description**  

**Environment**  
You will join a small technical team of about thirty people in a very warm and fun work atmosphere. You get to choose the workstation that suits you best: it’s up to you to decide how you want to work!  

---

**Qualifications**  

**Required Skills**  
- Swift  
- Proven experience with a high-visibility B2C transactional app  

**Who are you?**  

Let’s talk about you now!  
- You are a graduate (M/F) with a BAC+5 degree (equivalent to a Master’s) from an engineering school or equivalent.  
- You are autonomous, rigorous, dynamic, curious, and proactive.  
- You have at least 5 years of experience.  

We are looking for real talents to accompany us in the long term, prioritizing the quality of our candidates over the quantity of resources.  

---

**Additional Information**  

**What we offer**  

Working at Free2Move means joining a tribe where excellence and a culture of performance go hand in hand with a great atmosphere, but also:  
- The opportunity to revolutionize mobility with us!  
- A fantastic onboarding experience with lots of surprises  
- Career growth opportunities  
- Cutting-edge work tools  
- Maximum collaboration between different teams  
- A Swile card to enjoy delicious meal deliveries!  
- Lunchtime foosball battles and frequent after-work events... (except during lockdowns)  
- Internationally-oriented teams and projects to improve your language skills!  

*This list is not exhaustive!*  

---

**Job Type**  
- Permanent Contract (CDI)  
- Immediate Availability  
- Remote/Telecommuting possible (Europe Timezone)  
- Onsite location 5 minutes from Saint Lazare station

Einleitung\r\n\r\nBei voize revolutionie:
**Introduction**

At voize, we are revolutionizing the care industry and setting new standards in documentation through artificial intelligence (AI). With our innovative solution, caregivers can dictate documentation directly on their smartphones, and our AI automatically generates precise and structured entries. This saves up to 18 minutes per caregiver daily while significantly improving documentation quality.

Our technology is also used in other industries, such as TÜV. We are a young, dynamic team supported by YCombinator and Redalpine, combining cutting-edge technology with social impact. With voize, you can actively shape the future of work – for caregivers, professionals, and many others.

For our next big steps, we are looking for you as an **Android Engineer**!

Our team at voize consists of 35 passionate members working in product/development, data, customer success, sales, support, marketing, and HR. We are a dynamic and ambitious team that collaborates closely to continuously improve our voice AI solutions for the care industry. Our company culture offers a lot of freedom in how we work and a strong enthusiasm for modern technologies. At voize, we place great value on data-driven decisions to optimize processes and provide the best possible service to our customers. Everyone on the team is motivated to think creatively and actively contribute to the development of our products.

---

**Your Responsibilities**

**Your Mission at voize**  
- Take central responsibility for the development and technical implementation of our Android apps (Kotlin & Jetpack Compose).  
- Develop features that noticeably simplify the daily lives of users and bring them to market from idea to implementation. We iterate and ship quickly.  
- Design the voize SDK and enable partners to seamlessly integrate our AI technology.  
- Enjoy working closely with the founders and customers to translate requirements directly into creative and efficient solutions.  
- Oversee the entire development cycle: from the concept phase to testing and user feedback.  

---

**Qualifications**

**Must-Have:**  
- 3+ years of experience in Android development with Kotlin and Jetpack Compose.  
- Experience in developing SDKs or developer tools.  
- Solid knowledge of Git, CI/CD processes, and testing frameworks.  
- A keen eye for design and the ability to create intuitive and user-friendly interfaces.  
- Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively with customers, partners, and our team.  
- Fluent German and English skills at C1 level.  

**Nice-to-Have:**  
- Knowledge of Kotlin Multiplatform and Compose Multiplatform.  
- Experience with iOS development, TypeScript, or React.  
- Interest in backend development with Kotlin or DevOps topics like Docker.  

---

**Benefits**  
- Our office is located in Berlin, and we offer remote work options.  
- Flexible working hours because you know best when you work most effectively!  
- An open culture with regular work weeks and team events where we collaborate and bond.  
- Free Germany Ticket and Urban Sports Club membership.  
- We are a fast-growing startup with diverse challenges, providing the perfect foundation for rapid personal growth.  
- Your work can make a real impact by helping to ease the workload of caregivers.  
- Become a shareholder in voize with your own virtual shares.  

---

**A Few Final Details About the Team and Application Process**

**Team**  
Here, you’ll find an inspiring environment where you can develop your skills and help us revolutionize the care industry.  

**Application Process**  
- **Talent Call (Video Call):** Get to know each other and discuss the role.  
- **Technical Interview (Video Call):** Focus on your skills and projects.  
- **Pair Programming Challenge (Onsite in Berlin):** Solve a real-world challenge as part of the team.  
- **Contract Discussion (Video Call):** Finalize the details.  

---

**Contact**  
We look forward to your application and to getting to know you!

Deine Mission Dein Fokus liegt auf der E:
**Your Mission**  
Your focus will be on the development of the iOS mobile app and SDK for our Verimi system. You will ensure that our software improves every day. You will contribute to keeping our software up to date through code reviews, unit tests, and integration tests. As part of an agile team, you will bring your knowledge and ideas to the table when it comes to architectural changes. You will support product management in turning ideas into user stories. You enjoy discussing click-dummies and user flows with the team.  

**Your Profile**  
- You have a degree in computer science or a related field.  
- You have experience as a developer for iOS devices.  
- You are proficient in Swift, the iOS platform, Xcode, and REST web services.  
- You have solid knowledge of clean mobile architectures (e.g., MVVM, VIPER).  
- You are passionate about modern development approaches like CI/CD.  
- You work in an organized and performance-oriented manner.  
- You take responsibility for your work and are a good team player.  
- You are fluent in English.  

**About Us**  
**Verimi ID-Wallet** – your digital wallet. As a solution provider for identity verification and secure authentication, we make it easy for you to perform an ID check and store your digitally captured data in our Verimi ID-Wallet. This allows you to log in securely and conveniently with our partners, identify yourself digitally with just a few clicks, sign documents digitally, or make payments effortlessly.  

We are not alone in our mission to create a digitized world without analog barriers. We can rely on the support of our shareholders from the German economy, including Allianz, Atruvia, Bundesdruckerei, Deutsche Bahn, Deutsche Telekom, DZ-Bank, GDV, and Volkswagen Financial Services, who have invested in Verimi.  

**Why Verimi?**  
We are passionate about data security and have the unique opportunity to shape the future of digital identity management in Germany and Europe. Our work areas are diverse and offer many opportunities for creativity and initiative.  

We welcome applications from all nationalities and place great value on diversity in our teams. Equal opportunity is an important part of our values, so we explicitly encourage people with disabilities to apply.  

**Workplace:**  
You can expect a central, modern, and well-equipped workplace in the heart of Berlin.  

**Teams:**  
With agile and cross-functional project teams, we are able to collaboratively implement even the most complex project requirements.  

**Hybrid Work:**  
Every Wednesday, everyone meets on-site – our managing directors and team leaders also meet on Thursdays. On other days, you can decide flexibly where you work.  

**Benefits and Compensation:**  
In addition to a fair salary and usually a permanent employment contract, we offer various benefits, such as subsidies for public transport (BVG), an Urban Sports membership, meals, internet or mobility costs, and discounts through our partner Corporate Benefits.  

**Vacation:**  
You will receive 30 days of vacation (plus an additional 0.5 days for Christmas and New Year's Eve), as well as special leave for significant occasions like your wedding or the birth of your child.  

**OKRs:**  
We plan our quarters and year with OKRs at the company and team levels.  

**Development:**  
We support the further education of all employees with a training budget, internal training measures, a comprehensive onboarding program for new starters, quarterly feedback sessions, and annual development discussions.  

**Values and Culture:**  
We are a diverse and intercultural team with 90+ employees from over 20 nations and foster an open corporate culture guided by our Verimi values (Trust - Respect - Integrity - Responsibility - Innovation - Transparency).  

**Relocation Support:**  
We assist you with organizing your visa and relocation to Berlin.

**Junior/Medior Android Developer (Kotlin, Java, React Native, Flutter)**  

We are looking for a new colleague to join our Budapest-based IT development team as an Android Developer (Kotlin, Java, React Native, Flutter) in a full-time employee position, with the option of 2 days of home office per week (office location: József Nádor Square 5-6). The start date is negotiable, and we are happy to wait for the right candidate.  

We have offices in both Szeged and Budapest. Projects in Szeged primarily involve research and development tasks related to IT security, as well as vulnerability assessments for our partners. In Budapest, we work on market-oriented development projects (Android, .NET, Angular) and artificial intelligence.  

You will work alongside a tech lead colleague, so independence is important. The selection process consists of an in-person interview and a take-home assignment, for which you will have one week to complete (estimated time: 3 hours).  

We value openness to a diverse tech stack. We are looking for a colleague who is not only interested in working in a specific area but is also open to learning and using new technologies due to the variety of projects. For Android development projects, we develop based on client requirements (technologies used: Kotlin, Java, React Native, Flutter). While we don’t expect you to have experience in all of these, openness to learning is essential. iOS experience is considered an advantage.  

We also encourage interest in backend application development, which may involve .NET or Node.js.  

**Projects:**  
- Courier service project  
- Restaurant payment system project  
- Other confidential projects, some of which are related to security  

We are primarily looking for a Kotlin developer, but if you have experience with other mobile development languages (Flutter, Swift, React Native, etc.) and are open to working with a diverse tech stack, experience in any of these is acceptable. As a mobile developer, your primary responsibility will be daily development tasks, but in reality, the role is more varied. On the one hand, we welcome your ideas during the planning phase, and on the other hand, since the world of development is constantly evolving and we work with the latest technologies, you will need to find solutions to a wide range of challenges. Of course, our tech lead colleague will provide all the support and assistance you need.  

**Requirements:**  
- 1-3 years of experience in Android application development (even on hobby projects)  
- Confident experience in at least one of the following and openness to learning the others: Kotlin, Java, Ionic, React Native, Flutter  
- Confident use of Android Studio and version control systems (e.g., Git)  
- Experience integrating RESTful APIs  
- Ability to create responsive and optimized mobile applications  
- Debugging and performance optimization skills  
- Intermediate English language skills (Hungarian team)  
- Strong problem-solving and analytical skills  
- Ability to work independently and take initiative  
- Openness to developing native or Flutter applications  

**Advantages:**  
- Interest in the security field  
- Flutter experience  
- iOS experience  
- .NET experience  

**Responsibilities:**  
- Designing, developing, and maintaining Android applications  
- Implementing custom solutions based on client and user needs  
- Adhering to coding standards and quality assurance procedures  
- Introducing and testing new technologies and tools  

**What we offer:**  
- Cafeteria benefits (gross 450,000 HUF/year)  
- +1 month bonus  
- Health insurance  
- Health savings account  
- Financial and time support for professional exams and training  
- 2 days of home office per week  
- Team-building events multiple times a year  
- Competitive salary based on your expertise

**Role:** iOS Developer  

**Location:** Arezzo  

ALTEN supports its clients' development strategies in the areas of innovation, R&D, and technological information systems.  

Founded over 30 years ago and present in 30 countries, the ALTEN Group has established itself as a global leader in engineering and IT services and as a European leader in consulting for the Life Sciences industry.  

We work with key players in the following sectors: Aerospace & Space, Defense & Naval, Security, Automotive, Railway, Energy, Life Sciences, Financial, Retail, and Services.  

With a turnover of over €4.069 billion, we currently have more than 57,400 employees worldwide. In Italy, we are present in 12 cities across the country: Turin, Milan, Gallarate, Brescia, Genoa, Modena, Maranello, Bologna, Florence, Rome, Naples, and Bari.  

**What you will do:**  
- Design, develop, and maintain iOS applications;  
- Collaborate with design and development teams to implement new features;  
- Fix bugs, optimize application performance, and ensure an excellent user experience;  
- Write clean, scalable, and maintainable code;  
- Actively participate in code reviews and knowledge sharing with the team.  

**Requirements:**  
- At least 4 years of experience in iOS development;  
- Excellent knowledge of Swift;  
- Experience with Xcode, Git, and debugging tools;  
- Familiarity with MVVM/MVC architecture principles;  
- Knowledge of RESTful APIs and backend service integration;  
- Ability to work in a team and manage tasks independently.  

**Why choose ALTEN?**  

**Technological challenges**  
We believe technology has great potential to improve our future, which is why we seek talents motivated to build the world of tomorrow today. With our client portfolio and various active R&D projects, at ALTEN, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects. Our Technical Direction will guide and support you throughout your journey. You will have the chance to challenge yourself in diverse project contexts and interact with industry experts to continuously expand your knowledge. You can combine your passions and grow professionally. Are you ready to take on the challenge?  

**Inspiring Togetherness**  
We are committed to fostering a serene and collaborative work environment by organizing team-building activities, social initiatives, and sports events to get to know each other better and share moments together. The success of a group is based on cooperation and mutual sharing of knowledge and interests.  

**Fulfilling Opportunities**  
At ALTEN, you will find cutting-edge training courses to enhance your technological and linguistic skills! Through the ALTEN Academy, you can obtain certifications with some of the most important international frameworks, such as IREB®, ISTQB®, and others. Additionally, through Aula Streaming, you will have access to more transversal training courses related to soft skills and can choose from 12 foreign language courses.  

**Sustainable Commitment**  
We believe technology supports social development and environmental protection. In addition to collaborating on projects aimed at sustainability, we are committed to supporting causes we care deeply about, having collaborated and continuing to collaborate with organizations such as AISM, AIRC, LILT, Save the Children, Treedom, and This Unique. We value uniqueness and are committed to ensuring that all our people have equal opportunities within our company, providing them with the tools to fully express their potential. Our approach to diversity and inclusion is based on principles of ethics and integrity and represents the key factor for developing broader horizons for personal and corporate growth. We promote the employment and integration of individuals belonging to protected categories, as regulated by Law 68/99.  

**Next Steps**  
Once we receive your CV, we will take the necessary time to carefully evaluate it.  

If it aligns with this or other open positions within the Group, our Talent Acquisition team will contact you by phone.  

The selection process will continue with an introductory interview with the Business area, followed by a more in-depth interview, during which a practical test may be requested, and finally, a technical interview.  

The order and number of interviews may vary depending on selection needs.  

Alternatively, we will be happy to keep your CV in our database to reassess it for future opportunities. Operating in 12 different cities and as many sectors, you may be contacted by multiple Talent Acquisition Partners and/or Business Managers if they believe your profile aligns with the projects and needs they are seeking at that time.  

If you identify additional offers of interest and in line with your profile, we look forward to your application so we can evaluate it again.  

ALTEN operates in compliance with the principles of diversity, equity, and inclusion, which fuel our values. ALTEN aims to break down all barriers and prejudices, ensuring an accessible and welcoming work environment, evaluating applications regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability (Articles 1 and 18, Law 68/99), age, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, personal and political beliefs, union membership, family responsibilities, and socio-economic background.

Descrizione dell'azienda\r\n\r\nMOLO17 è:
**Company Description**

MOLO17 focuses on NoSQL technologies to create products and solutions capable of unlocking the potential of data while ensuring zero downtime and no impact on business continuity. MOLO17 has offices in the USA (Cupertino, CA) and EMEA, with an R&D center in Pordenone, Italy.

We are the first Italian company to win international recognition for the best software architecture based on Couchbase's NoSQL database at Couchbase Connect 2021 in Santa Clara, California.

You can learn more about our recent award 😊 [https://molo17.com/it/2021/11/molo17-premiata-al-couchbase-connectonline-2021/](https://molo17.com/it/2021/11/molo17-premiata-al-couchbase-connectonline-2021/)

**Our Values**

What drives us in pursuing our ambitions are the founding values of our company, the core principles shared by all colleagues at MOLO17:
- **Cooperation**: Human connection and collaboration are promoted and encouraged.
- **Passion**: The joy we find in our work ensures that what we do is of high quality.
- **Honesty**: We always communicate openly and are aware of the importance of ethical behavior both within and outside the company.

**Our Vision**

We aim to become the benchmark in the market for enterprise software solutions centered on human experience, making data available anytime and anywhere.

**How We Work and Ensure High-Quality Standards**

We strictly follow the Agile Scrum methodology, always keeping our promises: guaranteed delivery times and project budgets.

Our delivery team is divided into three main areas:
- **Support and Application Maintenance Team**: "Atlantis"
- **Professional Services Team**: The core of delivery, working on projects built on top of our products and/or tailor-made projects for enterprise clients.
- **Product Team**: Always attentive to market needs, designing and creating products used by system integrators and database vendors worldwide.

For all our projects, we dedicate significant time to studying the architecture. We avoid rushed decisions that could cost us more time in the future.

We work with Swift, using the MVVM pattern, and leverage SwiftUI, Combine, and Concurrency.

Our mobile solutions are renowned for using embedded NoSQL databases, ensuring the ability to operate even in complete absence of an internet connection. This allows us to create mission-critical applications, such as the famous Zulu .E platform, a platform for emergency medical services recognized as one of the three most important applications of Couchbase technology in the e-health sector. 😉

We place great importance on testing, both automated (unit and integration tests) and manual (Quality Assurance). Our motto is "Zero regressions," and this is confirmed and recognized by the international market.

**Job Description**

As an iOS developer, you will work alongside other developers and designers to develop mobile solutions for our clients, coordinated by our Delivery Manager, Eleonora, and our CTO, Alex.

Your role will involve actively participating in the selection of technologies, patterns, and methods to implement the assigned project, with the goal of fostering growth for yourself and your colleagues.

**Qualifications**

Our ideal candidate is someone who:
- Has prior experience as an iOS developer.
- Technically, has an excellent knowledge of:
  - Swift and its structures (e.g., Optionals, enums, closures, extensions, custom operators).
  - Xcode.
  - Git.
- Possesses excellent interpersonal skills. MOLO17 is a team, not a collection of individuals.
- Is eager to take on challenges and learn.
- Has a mindset geared toward constant self-improvement.
- Is passionate about their work: we are looking for people who share our passion for the IT world and the ambition to change the world.
- Can’t wait to watch the next WWDC with us. 😉

**Preferred Qualifications:**
- Knowledge of the MVVM pattern.
- Proficiency in English (certifications are a plus).
- Familiarity with Scrum and/or Agile methodologies.
- Knowledge of the Swift Concurrency framework.
- Knowledge of the SwiftUI framework.
- Experience with a data persistence framework (e.g., Core Data, Realm, or Couchbase).
- Willingness to travel if necessary (including internationally).

If you feel you lack some of the requirements, contact us anyway. With the desire to learn, any gap can be quickly filled!

**Additional Information**

Every team member receives:
- A MacBook Pro.
- Performance-based bonuses.
- Training and certification courses for AWS, MongoDB/Realm, Couchbase, and other partner technologies required for specific projects.
- Participation in team-building events: we strongly believe in emotional intelligence and the benefits it brings to teamwork.

Compensation will be commensurate with the candidate's experience and the agreed contractual terms.

**Remote Work Position**: In-person meetings can be scheduled with your managers and planned for company events.

¡Gracias por tu interés en Scotiabank!\r:
Thank you for your interest in Scotiabank!

Our group is strongly committed to promoting a workplace where you feel supported by your supervisors, ensuring your success and that of every client.

**Purpose**

Contribute to the mobile development area by supporting the execution of objectives, plans, and initiatives prioritized by the product area. Ensure that all activities carried out in development adhere to the procedures, practices, and requirements that guarantee a quality deliverable.

**Responsibilities**

- Design and create advanced applications for the iOS platform.
- Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to define, design, and deliver new features.
- Write unit tests to ensure robustness, including edge cases, usability, and overall reliability.
- Work on troubleshooting and improving application performance.
- Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.
- Lead pair programming sessions.
- Explain trade-offs in complex solutions to less experienced team members.
- Work with Agile methodology for application development.
- Participate in and approve Secure Code Assessment activities.
- Understand the structure of a user story and contribute to their creation (GWT, INVEST, SMART).
- Properly refine user stories outside of refinement ceremonies and only present the proposed solution to the team to clarify doubts and assign points.
- Understand the Bank's risk culture and how risk appetite should be considered in daily activities and decisions from both a technical and business perspective.
- Provide constructive feedback to team members.
- Clearly communicate technical decisions and explain their context.
- Actively participate in refinement sessions.
- Demonstrate autonomy in executing duties.

**Experience**

- Proven work experience in software development (>2 years).
- Work experience in iOS development.
- Proficiency in Swift.
- Published one or more iOS applications in the App Store.
- Experience with iOS systems such as Core Data, Core Animation, Core Location, and Core Text.
- Experience with third-party libraries and APIs like AlamoFire and Firebase.
- Practical knowledge of clean architectures and SOLID principles.
- Practical knowledge of reactive programming (Swift Combine).
- Knowledge of Gitflow for code versioning.
- Deep understanding of the entire mobile application development lifecycle.
- Knowledge of secure data persistence.
- Experience in application communication security.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each person brings to the bank, and we are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. All employees must comply with the bank's policies, standards, codes, and guidelines related to non-discrimination and workplace accommodations.

"If you need any type of accommodation regarding accessibility during the process, please inform our Talent Attraction team."

**Recommendations for your application:**

1. Ensure you have been in your current position for at least one year at the time of your application.
2. Validate the requirements, and if you meet them, apply.
3. Talk to your current supervisor and inform them about your application.
4. Remember that you can only apply for one position at a time.

- *Scotiabank is an inclusive company that respects diversity and does not discriminate in any way.*
- *Under no circumstances do we request pregnancy or HIV tests.*

We appreciate your interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

**iOS Developer at BairesDev**

At BairesDev®, we have been leading technology projects for 15 years for clients like Google, Rolls-Royce, and the most innovative startups in Silicon Valley. Currently, we have a team of 4,000 professionals made up of the top 1% of the industry, working remotely from over 50 countries. **iOS Developer at BairesDev**

Being a Senior iOS Developer on our Development team is like being a full-time problem solver. We expect your skills to be a combination of experience, knowledge, and independence. Innovation is also at the heart of BairesDev's strategy. So, if you're ready to take on the most complex tasks and master your tech stack for iOS, then you're probably one of the unique talents we're looking for.

**What will you do?**

- Build outstanding mobile applications that integrate with cloud services.
- Participate in the full product development lifecycle, from ideation to delivery and support.
- Work within a fast-moving team to develop sharp designs, write great code, and bring products to market quickly.
- Lead the development and implementation of key new enhancements.
- Continuously help us evolve our processes and designs to gain a competitive edge.
- Create mockups and prototypes to express ideas and gather feedback.
- Share your thoughts and ideas freely and constructively, while also listening well to others.
- Develop the best mobile applications for iOS devices and smartwatches.

**What are we looking for?**

- 6+ years of experience working as a developer.
- 5+ years of experience in iOS development.
- Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases.
- Experience with Microservices and Cloud technologies.
- Advanced knowledge of algorithms.
- Knowledge of IT infrastructure.
- Intermediate management of Agile methodology.
- Solid understanding of best practices, SOLID principles, CLEAN code, and scalable solutions.
- Knowledge of design patterns.
- Experience developing complete applications from scratch.
- Experience with automated testing, CI/CD processes.
- Strong experience with version control.
- Proven experience in unit testing, integration testing, and code coverage.
- Advanced level of English.

**What we offer to make your work (and life) easier:**

- 100% remote work: work from home or wherever you want.
- Compensation in USD or your local currency, as you prefer, well above the market average.
- Hardware and software.
- Flexible schedules.
- Paid maternity/paternity leave, vacation, and national holidays.
- Multicultural and innovative work environment, perfect for making friends, collaborating, and learning from the most talented people in the world.
- Opportunities for growth and professional development through mentorships and training.

**Join our global team!**

- **Build the modern church**
- **Competitive salary**
- **Start-up vibe**
- **Mobile-first focus**

**What we’re looking for:**

- **Android app development:** We expect you to build our platform for Android. You’ll be supported by a UX designer who will work with you to outline our MVP for Android.
- **Experience:** You’re familiar with Android and the challenges of developing for this platform.
- **Scalability:** It’s important to understand that we are a platform. We centrally develop technology that enables churches to launch their own app in the app store. You’ll write the code once, and it will be reused for each church.
- **Openness:** At Donkey Mobile, we want to help each other. If you run into an issue, we’ll work together to solve it. For this, it’s essential that you’re open about decisions and problems.
- **Last but not least:** We expect your input in setting up and further developing our product, driven by your experience and enthusiasm for the product.

**Does this sound like you?**

Meer weten? Bel 06-46465370!\r\n\r\nWij:
Here is the English translation of the job description:

---

**Want to know more? Call 06-46465370!**

We are Q42.

Q42 builds digital products that make people's lives smarter, better, and more fun.

For over 20 years, we’ve been helping companies like PostNL, Rijksmuseum, HEMA, AVROTROS, Philips Hue, and Efteling to conceptualize and create scalable products. Apps, websites, connected devices, AI applications, and more. From idea to launch.

Tech is at the core of everything we do. Our teams of developers and project managers are always experimenting, learning, and improving quickly. Until the product is enjoyable to use, grows the business, and puts a smile on our faces.

And we have a vacancy for Android developers.

We are looking for Android developers who enjoy working with other engineers on an international app with millions of users and transactions. In addition to developing apps for HEMA, PostNL, and *Wie is de Mol?*, this involves a new project.

**Focus on the end user**  
An example of how we work: the HEMA app. Recently, we built a native shop for HEMA with a strong focus on providing a great experience for the end user. The current challenge is to further improve that experience and add new features.

**Multidisciplinary team**  
The autonomous, multidisciplinary team building this app consists of about ten people. From Q42, this includes multiple Android and iOS developers plus a project manager. The team is further complemented by designers from Fabrique, a product owner, and a business analyst. We also regularly involve testers from Polteq. Naturally, we work agile. Since COVID, we’ve also been working partially remote.

**Latest technologies**  
From the start, we chose to build the HEMA app fully natively using Kotlin for Android and Swift for iOS. To combine the optimal performance of separate native applications with the convenience of hybrid development, we opted for server-driven UI and built a so-called "Backend for Frontend."

**Insight and advice**  
We always build and further develop an app in close collaboration with the client. Together, we determine the roadmap. Our insights and advice play an important role in this. In fact, we often take the initiative to develop new features ourselves.

**Variety guaranteed**  
Q’ers working in an app team occasionally participate in so-called jumpstarts, week-long sprints to prototype new concepts. Often, this is for other Q42 clients. Since we build apps for multiple organizations, switching to other projects is always possible, and Q’ers regularly move to a different team. For example, you might work on a corporate app for half the year and a start-up app for the other half. Your preferences are always taken into account in this planning.

Do you enjoy building large Dutch and international apps? Leave your details here, and we’ll get in touch with you soon. But feel free to keep reading—or apply for our iOS vacancy as well. 😉

---

**Does Q42 suit you?**

Want to know if Q—what we usually call Q42—is a good fit for you? We can already tell you what we offer and what we value. Then you can decide if there’s enough overlap for a conversation.  
- We offer an all-in salary of up to €6,500 per month, depending on your experience. This includes a maximum pension plan, holiday pay, and an internet allowance. (Here’s how we link salary, self-assessment, and personal development.)  
- We provide an environment we like to call a *happy place for nerds*. We’re not big on rigid structures. Many Q’ers do something extra beyond programming. This keeps Q flat and gives everyone the opportunity to contribute and grow.  
- With eighty smart developers, there’s plenty to learn at Q. From *Bedenktijdjes* and *Passietijd* to writing for our Engineering Blog and attending educational conferences together. Many Q’ers are also closely involved as mentors in the personal development of colleagues.  
- Our work is product development: creating the very best product to amaze the end user. We do this with *Wie is de Mol?*, PostNL, Rijksmuseum, HEMA, Volkskrant, Radio 538, 9292, Kramp, Efteling, and other great clients and partners.  
- But we also develop our own products through our ventures, like our tech-for-good start-up Hack The Planet. These ventures make us better at product thinking, which we can apply to our projects—and vice versa.  
- At our offices in Amsterdam and The Hague, we can get in the zone and throw great parties. We love doing fun things together: from the annual Q outing and our hackathon to pub quizzes and board game nights in our own cozy pub.  
- Want to know more? Drop by one of our public meetups or read our detailed story on the vacancies page!  
- Also relevant: our employment conditions.  

---

**Do you fit with Q?**

Experience is a plus, but it’s not the most important thing. Your technical potential and the match matter more.  
- Do you love building beautiful things with Kotlin and Compose?  
- Do you prioritize user-friendliness?  
- Does our *happy place for nerds* appeal to you?  

**Please note:** we don’t hire applicants living outside the European Union.

---

**See enough overlap?**

Let’s have a chat! You’re welcome at our office in Amsterdam or The Hague. Click the button below, and we’ll schedule a meeting. Or call Maurice directly to set up an appointment: 06-46465370.

---

**Our application process.**

“A what? A process?” Yes, we know, we’re not fans either. Luckily, we don’t have much of one. But since hiring new people is super important, we’ve come up with a way to do it really well. Here’s how it works:  
- Click on "I want to get to know you!" and tell us your story.  
- We’ll organize a conversation to chat about you and Q. Think in advance about whether you can show us some code you’re proud of. That’s much more fun to look at than a CV.  
- After that, we’ll have another conversation. But this time, you’ll get homework: a fun programming assignment in the language you think fits best.  
- The final step is a pair-programming afternoon. You’ll join two developers for about three hours. It’s a great way for you to get to know some Q’ers better and see our work up close. It’s also great for us because we like to involve as many Q’ers as possible in the hiring process. Afterward, we ask them: “Would you be disappointed if we didn’t hire her/him?” If they say “yes,” we know enough. 😊  
- We’ll make you an offer, sign the papers, and you’ll come here to have fun and make a difference.  

In this blog post, we explain more about our application process, the different steps, how we evaluate, what we look for in a candidate, etc.

---

**Oh, and recruiters:** we’re really good at finding new colleagues ourselves. Your help is neither needed nor wanted.

---

**The people of Q42**

We call our people Q’ers. Below, you’ll see a few of them. If you’d like to see all Q’ers and filter by all kinds of relevant and completely irrelevant criteria, you can do that too!  

---

**What will you be doing as an Android Developer at Social Deal?**  
• You will develop our native Android apps.  
• You will brainstorm and build new features.  
• You will implement design changes and resolve any bugs.  
• You will create test plans in collaboration with other departments.  
• You will prioritize your own work in consultation with your team and the Product Owner.  
• You will present demos to stakeholders, such as management and other departments.  
• You will have daily discussions with other Android and iOS Developers, tackling bugs for optimal results and implementing new features.  

**Who will you be working with?**  

You will join a friendly team of 30 developers. While the work is often serious and focused, there’s always room for a joke. Beers and social drinks are regularly on the agenda.  

**Colleague Android Developer Jamam Witwit:**  
“At Social Deal, I work in a multidisciplinary team on the app to ensure our customers can find the best deals every day. My work is very diverse; sometimes I’m building components, developing new features, or refining tickets for the backlog. Although it’s hard work, you get a lot in return: the best outings, great colleagues, and an amazing work atmosphere. Additionally, I have the opportunity to develop myself. For example, every Friday I can participate in a hackathon and work on topics that interest me. In short, there’s so much possible at Social Deal.”  

**What do we find important?**  
• That you enjoy coming to work!  
• Extensive knowledge of Android, Kotlin, and Java.  
• Experience with design patterns such as MVVM and MVC.  
• Experience with Jetpack Compose is a big plus.  
• Flexibility. You can quickly switch between different tasks and take on team members’ tasks when needed.  
• The ability to respond ad hoc to the needs of our consumers.  
• A problem-solving and independent work approach, while being a true team player.  
• That you find challenges with us and continue to develop yourself! That’s why we have a Hackathon every Friday afternoon where you can work on your own ideas.  

**What do you get from us?**  
• A salary that matches your work experience, 8% holiday allowance, travel expense reimbursement, and pension contributions.  
• 25 paid vacation days and the option to take 25 unpaid vacation days (based on full-time employment).  
• We work with an annual review cycle where we focus on your personal development and growth! You set your growth goals yourself through your Social Growth development plan.  
• The possibility to work (partially) from home.  
• An employment contract for 32 to 40 hours per week at one of the fastest-growing internet companies in the Netherlands. Did you know that Social Deal has been named Best Employer by Indeed twice in a row?  
• A shared lunch provided by a top caterer, free use of our gym, a game room for relaxation, and Friday afternoon drinks at our own bar or rooftop terrace!  
• 10% discount on all Social Deals.  
• Legendary parties, unique events, team outings, and fun social drinks.  
• Free access to the coolest Deals, exclusively for employees; from sports classes to tastings and from massages to workshops. All with a focus on team building, personal development, and, of course, relaxation.  
• A workplace that meets all your expectations in a stunning office at a prime location in ’s-Hertogenbosch, right behind the Central Station.  

**More about Development at Social Deal**  

Recently, we’ve been busy setting up completely new native apps and implementing a new design in the Social Deal app. Additionally, we’re always working on new features to stay ahead of the competition and ensure the app works optimally. On average, 20 vouchers are sold every minute, and you and your team ensure the purchasing process via the app runs smoothly. You and the team also work closely together to meet ambitious deadlines.  

**Do you think you’re the person we’re looking for? Great!**  
Send an email including your CV, motivation, and photo to jobs@socialdeal.nl or click HERE to apply directly!  
You’ll hear back from us within five working days! Do you have any questions? Call or message our Recruiter Sanne at 088-2050508.
