**The Job**  
We have received many new requests from our clients that we want to implement in our native mobile CRM application, and therefore, we are looking for a new colleague. Someone with a talent for mobile development and experience with CRM systems. Hence the job title: Android Developer, the Greatest.  

No fake news: our team ensures that our clients can work more efficiently, regardless of time or place. We achieve this through our in-house developed CRM system and accompanying apps.  

Innovation is a top priority for us. You will dedicate sufficient time to staying up-to-date with the latest developments in the Mobile Development world. You will experiment with new tools and technologies, and if the results are positive, you will apply them to ongoing or future projects.  

Your personal and professional development is also an important focus for us. You will have the time and budget to work on this. Think of attending a seminar, participating in or organizing a knowledge-sharing session, or taking a specific course.  

**The Ideal Profile**  
We don’t just hire anyone and are looking for a developer with a broad profile. Our ideal candidate meets the majority of the following mix of personal qualities, experiences, and skills:  
- Completed, relevant higher education (HBO level)  
- A healthy sense of humor  
- Excellent command of the English language  
- A good communicator, able to communicate at all levels within an organization  
- A hunger for new knowledge and a desire to learn new skills  
- Several years of experience as an Android developer (2+ years)  
- Excellent knowledge of MySQL, Kotlin, MVVM, MVP, and GIT  
- Familiar with Fake News, such as Fox News  

**Salary & Benefits**  
We set incredibly high standards for this position, the highest standards, trust us, they’re the best! Of course, we compensate more than fairly:  
- An excellent salary, more than enough for rent or a mortgage and other fixed expenses  
- The best equipment to do your job as well as possible, such as a laptop, tablet, and smartphone  
- Plenty of vacation days to take an amazing trip to the USA every year, and vacation pay to buy some beautiful flags  
- A pension plan

By using Flitsmeister, you can avoid unnecessary fines, drive more safely, and bypass traffic jams on your route. Our apps inform you about the locations or lengths of traffic jams, road closures, traffic reports, accidents, mobile speed cameras, fixed speed cameras, and average speed checks that are relevant to you. Additionally, Flitsmeister alerts you to approaching emergency services such as ambulances and vehicles from the Dutch road authority (Rijkswaterstaat). Drive more safely by receiving early warnings and save money by staying informed about various traffic updates.

Flitsmeister has a close-knit community of many users on Android and iOS platforms. We brainstorm new features and expand existing ones. Over the past year, we’ve worked hard on our subscription models and the software for our new hardware device: Flitsmeister DASH.

Als IOS developer binnen het dynamische:
**English Translation:**

As an iOS developer within the dynamic ComIT division, you will be partly responsible for developing an app with more than 4 million users!  

**You contribute to the mobility of the Netherlands**  
- Plenty of development opportunities  
- Excellent employment conditions  

**Why you want to work as an iOS developer at NS**  
- You get the unique opportunity to build an app with 4 million monthly users.  
- You will join a forward-thinking DevOps team with the freedom to propose ideas and experiment with new technologies.  
- The teams are end-to-end responsible for the entire process, from discovery, user research, design, development, to continuous improvement. The app and backend APIs are run and hosted by the teams themselves:  
  *"You build it, you run it, you love it."*  

**What you will do as an iOS developer**  

As an iOS developer, you are responsible for further developing and maintaining the NS app. You will build user-friendly features that meet the highest quality standards. Your main focus will be on functionalities that proactively inform our travelers.  
- You actively work on user interfaces and features that meet the needs of the users.  
- You collaborate closely with the business analyst, product owner, and other developers to translate functional and business requirements into technical solutions.  
- You write structured and clean code and address legacy code when you encounter it.  
- You improve the quality, reliability, and robustness of the NS app by working in a test-driven manner.  
- You stay up to date with the latest iOS development trends and technologies.  

**Where you will work**  

At our headquarters near Utrecht Central Station and from home (in our digital office), you will work in a multidisciplinary DevOps team consisting of 4 multidisciplinary developers. The team also includes 2 business analysts, a scrum master, and a product owner. A solution architect oversees the target architecture.  

We brainstorm about great solutions, work hard together, and pioneer in our field and beyond. And, of course, you will also be doing what you love most: developing. We are happy to support you by offering the latest technologies.  

With our team, you will be one of six teams working together on the NS app. The iOS developers meet weekly to showcase their work and discuss general improvements. During these meetings, you can make an impact and help steer the direction. Among the developers, there is a culture where all input is valued, and nothing is "set in stone."  

**The codebase**  

The codebase is based on the MVVM-C architecture. However, there is a constant challenge to innovate. For example, we are actively modularizing using Swift Package Manager and increasingly working towards sustainable implementations of SwiftUI. One of the interesting challenges here is how to best integrate this with our current reactive architecture. This process is approached iteratively and with room for experimentation. Dependencies are developed in-house as much as possible and omitted where necessary. Features are built using our own design system, Nessie.  

**Job requirements**  

You are eager to learn, quick to adapt, and see opportunities for improvement, bringing others along with you. Key elements of Agile working, such as collaboration, responding to changes, and delivering value in short cycles, align with your way of working. You have strong communication skills, show decisiveness, and are not afraid to make decisions.  

**What you bring**  
- You have a university-level working and thinking capacity.  
- You are an expert in developing iOS applications in Swift.  
- You are willing to eventually work on other systems within our domain, such as the Android app or backend systems.  
- You are enthusiastic, have a strong sense of responsibility, and do not focus solely on your own area of expertise.  
- Team spirit. With your flexibility and ability to collaborate, you strengthen your team.  
- Experience in writing automated tests, such as unit, integration, and UI tests.  
- You are interested in developments within the Apple ecosystem.  
- You can express yourself well in Dutch or English.  

**It’s a plus if you have experience with:**  
- CI/CD  
- SwiftUI  
- Reactive (RxSwift) and functional programming, and AutoLayout in code  
- Digitally accessible apps  
- Analytics, test-driven, and data-driven development  
- Working with feature flags and A/B tests  
- Refactoring legacy code  

At NS, we value diversity and inclusion. It makes collaboration more enjoyable and improves results. Your background or beliefs don’t matter to us; we are mainly curious about your vision for this role.  

**Still have questions about the application process?**  
Email Karin from our front office at: [email protected]  

**Prefer to contact us by phone?**  
Call our front office at the phone number listed on magnet.me.  

**Good to know:**  
- A background check, including a Certificate of Conduct (VOG), is part of the application process.

Willkommen bei EDEKA IT – dem zentralen:
Welcome to EDEKA IT – the central IT partner for the market leader in German grocery retail with over 11,000 stores. Together, we design innovative IT solutions that make retail powerful and future-proof. Our applications inspire our independent retailers, the 7 EDEKA wholesale companies, and the EDEKA headquarters. With multiple locations across Germany, we are driving the digitalization of retail. Become part of our team and help shape the future of retail with us.

At EDEKA IT, we are the heart of the digital transformation within the EDEKA Group. As a strong team, we develop IT strategies, infrastructures, and services for all areas of the EDEKA Group's business across Germany. We combine our expertise to develop and implement innovative solutions. This is how we are advancing the retail of tomorrow – maybe soon with you?

In your role as an iOS Developer for the EDEKA App (m/f/d), you can make your personal contribution to our goals. Possible work locations include: Berlin, Gaimersheim, Hamburg, Melsungen, Minden, Moers, Neumünster, Offenburg, Cluj-Napoca, Mannheim.

**iOS Developer EDEKA App (m/f/d)**

Within a 15-member team working agilely according to Scrumban, we are responsible for the native development of "state-of-the-art" apps for iOS and Android. We aim for high code quality and a high degree of automation in our CI/CD pipelines. We support each other and ensure that fun at work is not neglected.

**Your tasks**  
- In regular collaboration with Product Management and the Android team, you design and implement innovative features for our iOS app.  
- With a "getting things done" mindset, you work "end to end" and are involved in all phases of the development process, from requirements analysis to code reviews, unit/UI tests, and deployment or release management.  
- As part of continuous quality assurance, you ensure the optimization, scaling, and further development of our code.  

**Your profile**  
- You have successfully completed training or a degree in IT or possess a comparable qualification.  
- You have solid practical experience in native app development for iOS using Swift, SwiftUI, Combine, and RxSwift.  
- You enjoy developing simple, elegant apps that are user-friendly and fun to use.  
- You are open to experimenting and enjoy tackling complex challenges with creative solutions.  
- You have good German and English language skills, both written and spoken (CEFR level B2 or higher).  

**Our offer**  
- **Work-life balance:** Benefit from 30 days of vacation and the option to work remotely.  
- **Impact:** You will shape the IT of one of Germany's leading grocery retailers.  
- **Financial incentives & additional benefits:** Enjoy a 13th monthly salary and numerous benefits & employee offers as part of our appreciation for you.  
- **Comprehensive development (professional & personal):** We offer various training opportunities, such as digital learning platforms and the option to attend professional conferences.  
- **Occupational health management:** Our health management team takes care of your well-being at work.  
- **Culture & collaboration:** We ensure an optimal start in our company and place great value on good onboarding so that you can hit the ground running and actively participate in our various communities and networks from the beginning.  

**Interested?**  

We look forward to receiving your detailed application, including your salary expectations based on 13 monthly salaries, your possible start date, and we are excited to get to know you!  

We welcome all people – regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social background, disability, religion, age, or sexual orientation.  

**Contact**  
Personnel and Organization

Orange este ceea ce suntem si ceea ce fa:
Orange is who we are and what we do, every day.

Around the world, there are over 123 million people separated by distances, speaking different languages, and living different lifestyles. But they all chose the same thing: to communicate in the way they feel, to look toward the future with openness and optimism. Orange brings them all closer together, whether they live in the United Kingdom, France, Switzerland, Belgium, Austria, Spain, the Netherlands, Romania, Moldova, Poland, Slovakia, Russia, the United States, China, Korea, Japan, India, Vietnam, Botswana, Cameroon, the Dominican Republic, Egypt, Nigeria, Equatorial Guinea, Guinea Conakry, Guinea-Bissau, Ivory Coast, Uganda, Kenya, the Central African Republic, Madagascar, Mali, Mauritius, the Caribbean, New Caledonia, Reunion, Senegal, Vanuatu, India, Vietnam, Jordan, or Bahrain.

Orange is the brand under which France Telecom provides mobile communication, Internet, and television services. The France Telecom Group is one of the world leaders in telecommunications services, with over 183 million customers across five continents. Creativity, boldness, dynamism, openness, attention to detail, and consistency define Orange in everything it does. 

Orange means that we will break patterns and continue to evolve to offer you the quality services you need, along with innovation and transparency. At Orange Romania, in everything we do, we will shape more clearly each day what this universe means and the benefits it brings. 

We invite you to experience Orange, and we trust that we share the same belief: the future is truly bright.
Job description\r\n\r\nTekGPS Engineerin:
**Job Description**

**TekGPS Engineering SRL** is a company within the Textron Specialized Vehicles group, specializing in the development of management systems for electric vehicles used in recreational areas, particularly golf courses. Our products provide customers with an advanced multimedia interface to enhance the golfing experience.

**Textron Specialized Vehicles Inc.** is a leading global manufacturer of golf carts, utility and personal transportation vehicles, snowmobiles, off-road vehicles (side-by-sides), ATVs, professional turf maintenance equipment, and ground support equipment. Textron Specialized Vehicles markets products under several different brands. Its vehicles can be found in various environments, from golf courses, factories, airports, and residential communities to theme parks and hunting reserves.

**About the Job**

To maintain the highest standards in our work, we operate exclusively from the office. At this time, the option to work from home is not available.

**Location:** Pitești, Romania

**Required Qualifications:**

- **Education:** Students, Graduates  
- **Career Level:** Beginner (0-2 years), Intermediate (2-5 years), Advanced (>5 years)  
- **Job Type:** Full-time, Part-time  
- **English:** Intermediate level (written and spoken)  

We are currently looking for **Programmers** and **Testers** for software and hardware roles. The work is conducted at the company’s headquarters. We have five departments: Android, Server, Embedded, Testing, and Hardware. Depending on your aspirations and future goals, here are the requirements for the Software Development departments:

**Software Developers:**

**Responsibilities:**
- Develop, translate, and write code for new and existing software solutions, adhering to specifications, including user interfaces, databases, and back-end services.  
- Design, execute, and monitor Unit Tests for performance and Regression to identify defects, isolate areas for improvement, and debug.  
- Perform diagnostic analysis of test results and propose solutions for critical issues.  
- Promote and share knowledge of best practices in application development.  
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including network administrators, system analysts, programmers, and other software engineers, to resolve defects in company products or systems.  

**Requirements (what you need to know or be willing to learn):**

- **Android:** Android Studio, Java/Kotlin, XML, Azure DevOps, GIT  
- **Server:** C#, Entity Framework, MVC/ASP.NET, JavaScript, MSSQL Server, HTML/CSS, Knockout JS, Bootstrap, Leaflet JS, REST API, Microsoft SQL Server, Azure DevOps  
- **Embedded:** C/C++, Visual Studio, GIT, Azure DevOps, embedded systems/RTOS, peripheral buses (SPI, I2C, UART, CAN, etc.)  

You can send your CV to the following email address: **gbalici@textron.com**

- Experience with Android SDK, Jetpack, and Android Studio.

Our work environment is friendly and stimulating, encouraging creativity and collaboration. PSS – Prosoft Solutions offers the opportunity to work on international projects, the possibility to create and develop a career plan, flexible programs, and other benefits in line with the company’s performance standards.

Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget:
**English Translation:**

Techster Solutions is currently in an exciting growth phase and is now looking for more colleagues, starting with you who have at least 3+ years of experience and can strengthen the team.

You can expect a dynamic environment where no two days are the same – but one thing is certain: here, you will get to use your skills and set your own limits for how much you want to develop. **Role Description:**

You will join a team of highly skilled developers with an established network within the company’s software community. We work closely with, for example, UX/Design, the Product Owner, and tech leads. The position is based in Lund.

**Who are you?**  
You are a highly skilled software developer with experience working with AOSP, the Android framework, SystemUI, and Java/Kotlin app development. Quality thinking and taking ownership are part of your characteristics, and you naturally write testable and maintainable code. You are a true collaborator who feels comfortable handling complexity. You are used to working in cross-functional teams where collaboration with, for example, interaction and graphic designers, is part of the day-to-day work.

**What you need to bring with you:**  
- M.Sc in Software Engineering or corresponding relevant experience  
- Java/Kotlin app development  
- Experience in working within AOSP and Android Framework  
- Experience in Android stack and related development and build tools (Gradle and Soong build system)  
- Writing automated unit and integration tests as a natural part of design and implementation  
- Comfortable working in a Linux environment  
- Experience in working with Git/Gerrit/Jenkins tools  
- Good communication skills, including in English (written and spoken)  
- Swedish Driver's license (B-level) is required to be able to do testing in cars  

**It is meritorious if you have experience of:**  
- AIDL and Android HAL  
- C++ development  
- Experience from Android SystemUI  

**Application**  
Do you think you are Techster Solutions' next star? Then don’t hesitate to send in your application right away. Selection is ongoing, and the start date will be agreed upon.

**Workplace and Culture**  
We are an entrepreneur-driven IT company, with both product expertise and sales (Techster AB) and consulting services (Techster Solutions AB). This means we are very open to new technical solutions, knowledge sharing, and continuous learning. Having fun while maintaining a family-like atmosphere without hierarchies is equally important.

We want to create the consulting company you’ve always wanted to work for but perhaps haven’t found yet. Today, we already have a mix of senior and junior employees, as well as men and women. We want to continue building on that. So, welcome with your application!
Software Engineer (Android)\r\n\r\nDate:
**Software Engineer (Android)**  

**Date posted:** 03/14/  
**Location:** Gothenburg | Sweden  
**Company:** Worldline  

**Software Engineer (Android)**  

Worldline is growing and needs to strengthen the development department in Halmstad with additional Android developers who can contribute with both expertise, experience, and a great personality. We are looking for someone with a genuine interest in technology who enjoys working together with other developers in true team spirit.  

In our modern and spacious offices in Halmstad, around 60 wonderful Worldliners of mixed ages work in various fields. The product development team consists of about 20 people, and this is where we develop Worldline's products aimed at small and medium-sized retailers, primarily in the Nordic region. These range from card terminals and payment systems to customer-facing and internal web systems, tools, and APIs. Our payment services are used by tens of thousands of retailers who together process millions of transactions every day, all year round.  

Now, we are aiming even higher and planning to bring our products and services to small and medium-sized retailers across Europe. Worldline already has a well-established presence across Europe for a variety of customer segments, especially large clients and banks, so the products we are responsible for complement Worldline's portfolio very well.  

We offer a flexible hybrid model where you have great opportunities to work both on-site and remotely. However, we believe in togetherness and team spirit, so this position is not offered as fully remote.  

**Job Description**  

You will be part of an experienced development team focusing on developing our card terminals. A new generation of Android-based card terminals is being developed, which will gradually replace older generations. Here, you have a fantastic opportunity to be involved from an early stage in exciting work where new technology creates new opportunities for us and our customers.  

We work in an agile and product-driven way with several autonomous teams, striving for broad competence so that everyone can contribute as needed. We believe that communication and collaboration within the team, as well as with other teams, are the keys to success. We enjoy an open, helpful, and positive atmosphere.  

The team works with a broad tech stack, with Android and Kotlin as the main focus, and we always strive to learn new things and challenge ourselves to deliver better and more modern products and services to our customers.  

All teams have full technical ownership of several systems, where they jointly and in true DevOps spirit take responsibility for all aspects such as requirements, architecture, technology choices, development, testing, CI/CD, and deployment. Together with our product owners, you will shape our products to meet the needs of today and the future.  

**Personal Attributes**  
- You have a good sense of user-friendliness and quality.  
- You are passionate about learning new things and stay updated on modern development frameworks and methodologies.  
- You are attentive, eager to learn, and happy to share your knowledge with others.  
- You are a true team player with a positive, humble attitude.  

**Qualifications**  
- A few years of work experience in Android and Kotlin development.  
- Experience in test automation.  
- Experience in CI/CD.  
- Proficiency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.  

**Meritorious**  
- Skills, experience, and a good sense of UI design.  
- Competence in some of the technologies we work with daily:  
  - C# .NET, C/C++, SQLite, MariaDB, Elasticsearch, Grafana, Docker, Swagger, GitLab, TeamCity, Octopus Deploy.  

Submit your job application and CV as soon as possible, as we review applications on an ongoing basis. We look forward to hearing more about you, your passions, and your skills!
Tunstall är världsledande inom innovativ:
**English Translation:**

Tunstall is a world leader in innovative welfare technology; we develop technical solutions and systems for healthcare and social care. We are driven by helping individuals in vulnerable situations, and our vision is to shape a world where people have the freedom to live a fulfilling life in the place of their choice.

Would you also like to work in a business-driven and market-leading company? Preferably one with a clear purpose and strong values?

Then perhaps the role of **iOS Developer** is something for you!

**About the Role**

At our Nordic headquarters in Malmö, we are approximately 50 people within R&D.

As an iOS Developer, you will be part of a well-functioning and skilled team that works on further developing and improving our apps.

Our apps are used by staff in elderly care, for example, to plan care visits and to manage and respond to alarms from users. In other words, your efforts are directly linked to improving the daily lives of many people!

As an iOS Developer, you will:
- Develop and maintain iOS apps with high technical quality.
- Collaborate with UX designers and testers to create user-friendly solutions.
- Work closely with the product department to translate customer requirements and needs into functional and innovative applications.
- Explore and implement new technologies and working methods.

We work according to the agile SAFe framework.

**About You**

We are looking for someone with solid experience in modern iOS, Swift, and Swift UI development. You are technically curious and have a strong drive to find new solutions.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:
- Have experience developing user-friendly apps.
- Are motivated by working in a team with strong cohesion and a shared goal.

You are proficient in both Swedish and English, in speech and writing.

At Tunstall, you will have the opportunity to work in a secure and stable organization with great confidence in the future. We are proud to be at the forefront of developing future technical solutions for better care.

Our work environment is characterized by helpfulness and collaboration.

**Location and Application**

The position is based in Malmö with the possibility of hybrid work.

In this recruitment, we are collaborating with Cabeza AB. For questions about the role, contact recruitment consultant Malin Schultz: malin.schultz@cabeza.se.

Would you like to make a difference? Submit your application today! We look forward to getting to know you.
Vill du kombinera din passion för teknik:
**Do you want to combine your passion for technology and sports? Sportswik is looking for a dedicated iOS developer who wants to be part of an innovative team and contribute to the future of sports coverage!**

**About Us**

Sportswik is revolutionizing sports media coverage by giving every game the same attention as professional sports. Our app enables everyone, from fans to team leaders, to report live through photos, videos, comments, and results. We collaborate with major sports federations like the Swedish Football Association and the Floorball Federation to create user-generated content for thousands of matches.

We are a passionate startup with big ambitions, and we are now looking for an additional iOS developer to help us continue expanding and developing our platform.

**About the Role**

As an iOS developer at Sportswik, you will be a key part of our team, working with the latest technology to create the sports media platform of the future. You will have the opportunity to work on the entire development cycle, from design to implementation and maintenance of our iOS app, and to develop new features that enhance the user experience for sports fans worldwide.

**Who Are You?**

We are looking for someone with a genuine interest in both technology and sports, who loves creating smart and user-friendly solutions. You thrive in a startup environment where the pace is fast, innovation is a priority, and your ideas can quickly come to life. Ideally, you have an academic background and a few years of experience in iOS development. You are familiar with Objective-C, Swift, iOS frameworks, RESTful APIs, and have strong problem-solving skills. Experience as a full-stack developer is a plus but not a requirement.

At Sportswik, it’s all about the team before the individual. Together, we take responsibility for ensuring we continue to deliver a world-class product and constantly challenge each other to improve.

**Why Sportswik?**

With us, you’ll have a unique opportunity to help develop the sports media platform of the future. You’ll be part of a dynamic and ambitious team in Umeå, working at the forefront of technology. We offer a creative work environment with significant opportunities to influence your work and the company’s development.

**What We Offer:**
- An open and inspiring work environment where innovation is at the center.
- Flexible working hours and the ability to influence your schedule.
- The chance to work on a product that engages thousands of users daily.
- Competitive salary and great benefits.
- The opportunity to work with sports and collaborate with sports federations.

**Application**

For this recruitment, we have chosen to collaborate with Talentify. All questions regarding the process or the position should be directed to Hanna Grahn at hanna@talentify.se.

**Senior iOS Developer UIKit/SwiftUI**

**Location:** Switzerland - Remote with possible travel upon client request.

**Language:** French

**Required Experience:** Minimum 10 years in iOS development, with advanced expertise in Swift and SwiftUI.

---

### **Job Description**

We are looking for a Senior iOS Developer to join our dynamic and international team, specializing in the development of innovative mobile applications. As an expert in UIKit and SwiftUI, you will play a key role in the design, development, and maintenance of high-performance iOS applications.

This position is ideal for a mobile technology enthusiast with solid experience in Swift and proven skills in developing modern and seamless user interfaces.

---

### **Responsibilities**

- Design, develop, and maintain iOS applications using UIKit and SwiftUI.
- Translate functional concepts into intuitive and high-performing user interfaces.
- Collaborate with product, design, and engineering teams to ensure an optimal user experience.
- Conduct code reviews to maintain impeccable code quality and adhere to industry standards.
- Optimize application performance and ensure stability.
- Integrate RESTful APIs and other third-party services to enhance application features.
- Act as a technical reference for best practices in Swift and SwiftUI.
- Mentor and support less experienced developers within the team.

---

### **Desired Profile**

- Minimum 10 years of experience in iOS development.
- Advanced expertise in Swift, UIKit, and SwiftUI (mandatory requirement).
- Deep knowledge of object-oriented and functional programming concepts.
- Proven experience in performance optimization and memory management.
- Strong understanding of mobile architectures (MVC, MVVM, VIPER).

Here is the English translation of the job description:

---

**Want to know more? Call 06-46465370!**

**We are Q42.**

Q42 builds digital products that make people's lives smarter, better, and more fun.

For over 20 years, we’ve been helping companies like PostNL, Rijksmuseum, HEMA, AVROTROS, Philips Hue, and Efteling to conceptualize and create scalable products. Apps, websites, connected devices, AI applications, and more. From idea to launch.

Tech is at the core of everything we do. Our teams of developers and project managers are always experimenting, learning, and improving quickly. Until the product is enjoyable to use, grows the business, and puts a smile on our faces.

And we have a vacancy for Android developers.

**We are looking for Android developers** who enjoy working with other engineers on an international app with millions of users and transactions. In addition to developing apps for HEMA, PostNL, and *Wie is de Mol?*, this also involves a new project.

---

### **Focus on the end user**

As an example of how we work: the HEMA app. Recently, we built a native shop for HEMA with a strong focus on providing a great experience for the end user. The current challenge is to further improve that experience and add new features.

---

### **Multidisciplinary team**

The autonomous, multidisciplinary team building this app consists of about ten people. From Q42, this includes multiple Android and iOS developers plus a project manager. The team is further complemented by designers from Fabrique, a product owner, and a business analyst. We also regularly involve testers from Polteq. Naturally, we work agile. Since COVID, we’ve also been working partially remote.

---

### **Latest technologies**

From the start, we chose to build the HEMA app fully natively using Kotlin for Android and Swift for iOS. To combine the optimal performance of separate native applications with the convenience of hybrid development, we opted for server-driven UI and built a so-called "Backend for Frontend."

---

### **Insight and advice**

We always build and further develop an app in close collaboration with the client. Together, we determine the roadmap. Our insights and advice play an important role in this. In fact, we often take the initiative to develop new features ourselves.

---

### **Variety guaranteed**

Q’ers who are part of an app team occasionally participate in so-called jumpstarts, week-long sessions to prototype new concepts. Often, this is for other Q42 clients. Since we build apps for multiple organizations, switching to other projects is always an option, and Q’ers regularly move to a different team. For example, you could work on a corporate app for half the year and a start-up app for the other half. Your preferences are always taken into account in this planning.

---

**Do you enjoy building large Dutch and international apps?** Leave your details here, and we’ll get in touch with you quickly. But feel free to keep reading—or apply for our iOS vacancy as well. 😉

---

### **Does Q42 suit you?**

Want to know if Q—what we usually call Q42—is a good fit for you? We can already tell you what we offer and what we value. Then you can decide if there’s enough overlap for a conversation.

- We offer an all-in salary of up to €6,500 per month, depending on your experience. This includes a maximum pension plan, vacation pay, and an internet allowance. (Here’s how we link salary, self-assessment, and personal development.)
- We provide an environment we like to call a *happy place for nerds*. We’re not big on rigid structures. Many Q’ers do something extra beyond programming. This keeps Q flat and gives everyone the opportunity to contribute and grow.
- With eighty smart developers, there’s plenty to learn at Q. From *Bedenktijdjes* and *Passietijd* to writing for our Engineering Blog and attending educational conferences together. Several Q’ers also act as mentors, closely involved in the personal development of colleagues.
- Our work is product development: creating the very best product to amaze the end user. We do this with *Wie is de Mol?*, PostNL, Rijksmuseum, HEMA, Volkskrant, Radio 538, 9292, Kramp, Efteling, and other great clients and partners.
- But we also develop our own products through our ventures, like our tech-for-good start-up Hack The Planet. These ventures make us better at product thinking, which we can apply to our projects—and vice versa.
- At our offices in Amsterdam and The Hague, we can get in the zone and throw great parties. We love doing fun things together: from the annual Q outing and our hackathon to pub quizzes and board game nights in our own cozy pub.
- Want to know more? Drop by one of our public meetups or read our detailed story on the vacancies page!
- Also relevant: our employment conditions.

---

### **Do you fit in at Q?**

Experience is a plus, but it’s not the most important thing. Your technical potential and the match with us matter more.

- Do you love building beautiful things with Kotlin and Compose?
- Do you prioritize user-friendliness?
- Does our *happy place for nerds* appeal to you?

**Please note:** we don’t hire applicants living outside the European Union.

---

### **See enough overlap?**

Let’s have a chat! You’re welcome at our office in Amsterdam or The Hague. Click the button below, and we’ll schedule a meeting. Or call Maurice directly to set up an appointment: 06-46465370.

---

### **Our application process**

"A what? A process?" Yes, we know, we’re not fans either. Luckily, we don’t have much of one. But since hiring new people is super important, we’ve come up with a way to do it really well. Here’s how it works:

1. Click on "I want to get to know you!" and tell us your story.
2. We’ll organize a conversation to chat about you and Q. Think in advance about whether you can show us some code you’re proud of. That’s much more fun to look at than a CV.
3. After that, we’ll have another conversation. But this time, you’ll get homework: a fun programming assignment that you can complete in the language you think fits best.
4. The final step is a pair-programming afternoon. You’ll join two developers for about three hours. It’s a great way for you to get to know some Q’ers better and see our work up close. It’s also great for us because we like to involve as many Q’ers as possible in the hiring process. Afterward, we ask them: "Would you be disappointed if we didn’t hire her/him?" If they say "yes," we know enough. 😊
5. We’ll make you an offer, sign the papers, and you’ll come here to have fun and make a difference.

In this blog post, we explain more about our application process, the different steps, how we evaluate, what we look for in a candidate, etc.

---

**Oh, and recruiters:** we’re really good at finding new colleagues ourselves. Your help is neither needed nor wanted.

---

### **The people of Q42**

We call our people Q’ers. Below, you’ll see a few of them. If you’d like to see all Q’ers and filter by all kinds of relevant and completely irrelevant criteria, that’s possible too!

--- 

Let me know if you need further assistance! 😊

Creëerde beste gebruikerservaring in de:
**Job Description Translation: iOS Developer**  

**Create the best user experience in the app for Apple customers**  
**Full-time - hours per week | Bachelor’s degree level | Headquarters in Groningen**  

**Develop for iOS and develop yourself**  
The Employer App is a popular shopping app that the company is heavily focused on. This means you’ll be at the forefront of creating trendy new features, as well as essential basic features that are in high demand. Thanks to the variety of tasks, this is a unique opportunity to develop yourself as well.  

**How do we develop software?**  
Each team works on its own part of the software. These can be customer-facing components, but also our warehouse system or our in-house HR system. You’ll develop, optimize, and implement new features. All the systems we work on are developed in-house, allowing us to respond effectively to complex and challenging changes in the market. We also use these systems ourselves, but we build them as standalone software that is also interesting for other companies.  

So, while we are an online retailer, we see ourselves as a software company. Our scope is much broader than you might think.  

**Our tech stack**  
We work with Swift and/or Objective-C, and don’t forget GitLab, Docker, TypeScript, and Redis. We use various tools, including JetBrains, Slack, and Ubuntu/Windows. Our tech stack is always evolving because the tech world never stands still.  

**What will you do as an iOS Developer?**  
- You’ll help translate our business goals into well-functioning solutions.  
- You’ll build features from start to finish for your platform.  
- You’ll take responsibility for your part of the app.  
- You’ll contribute ideas about scalability and architecture.  
- You’ll have our trust to make your own technical decisions.  

**What can you expect from us?**  
- **Short release cycles**: We release our code multiple times a day. Straight to live.  
- **No hierarchy**: We don’t like it. You’re the technical expert, so no non-technical colleagues will interfere with your technical decisions.  
- **Proactively replace legacy code**: Every software has legacy code, but you won’t be stuck maintaining it forever.  
- **Informal work environment**: Everyone can be themselves here.  

**What do we offer?**  
In addition to a good salary, special Employer Benefits, a favorable pension plan, and annual vacation days, we also offer:  

**Who are you?**  
- You’re a guru in developing mobile applications for iOS.  
- You’re a true hero in object-oriented programming.  
- You work neatly and methodically, and you know exactly what a user expects from your app.  
- Swift and/or Objective-C are second nature to you.  
- You’re eager to learn and a real team player.  
- Experience with developing for multiple platforms is a big plus.  

**Do you have questions about this vacancy?**  
Feel free to contact our Talent & Recruitment Specialists. They are available on weekdays between [time] at [phone number]. You can also send an email to [email address].  

**Want to know what the application process looks like?**  
Click [link].  

**How do we work?**  
- Our development team is a mix of full-timers and part-timers, experienced professionals, and recent graduates.  
- We follow the MVP (Minimum Viable Product) approach to deliver value to users as quickly as possible.  
- We have fun together: there are company-wide and development-specific drinks and activities for those who want to join. Don’t want to? That’s fine too.  
- We’re ambitious and passionate. We love improving because we think it’s fun.  
- We have a flat organization where it’s about what you say, not who says it.  
- We don’t have fixed job profiles. This allows us to tailor your role to your strengths.  
- The development department works in English, but most colleagues also speak Dutch.  
- We have a work-from-home policy of up to two days per week. More days are possible in consultation.

Organisatie & Afdeling\r\n\r\nDit bedrij:
**Organization & Department**

This company is the ultimate technical haven when it comes to innovative projects where you can unleash your creative or analytical mind. Together with over 150 colleagues, you will work on high-end projects for a variety of clients.  
The company delivers holistic concepts, including strategy, development, design, and hosting. Application design and development, virtual reality, artificial intelligence, and cloud management are also part of their offered services.  

They do this for major clients in various sectors. One moment, you might be working on a VR & AR project for the healthcare industry, and the next month, you could be developing a high-quality application for a well-known TV program. Plenty of variety! All their solutions are focused on today’s trends, such as VR & AR and Artificial Intelligence, with the mission of "influencing the world by building better technology."  

A balance between fun and hard work is very important within this company. Because the projects are so interesting to work on, it almost doesn’t feel like work. However, time is still set aside for social events. Think of Tech Nights, meet-ups, events like "Funky Friday," and a cozy and creative office where you can unwind with various games, activities, and gadgets.  

**Role**

As an iOS developer, you will join our experienced team. This team works based on Scrum Agile and currently consists of 12 members, each bringing their own expertise. Together with your team, you will work on various projects for a wide range of clients, from large multinationals to small and medium-sized businesses. For example, think of clients like Ziggo and Buienradar.  

What sets this organization apart is that they truly establish long-term partnerships with their clients, making them a genuine innovation partner. As a result, you will also communicate directly with clients about their needs and requirements, and you will work with the team to always ensure quality.  

In addition to developing applications and other functionalities, there is also plenty of room for personal development. **What you will do**  

You start your day with a nice cup of tea/coffee and boot up your laptop. Around 9:00 AM, you join the stand-up meeting with the development team and share what you’ll be working on that day. Are you contributing to our on-demand streaming apps or a VoIP app? Afterward, you open the JIRA board and get started on your tasks. Before you know it, it’s 12:00 PM—time for lunch.  

After lunch, you challenge one of your colleagues to a game of pong. When you return to the office, you put on your headphones and continue working on your thesis/assignment. Then your workday is over. You pack up your things and head to your bike. See you tomorrow!

**Role:** Senior Android Developer  

**Location:** Arezzo  

**Responsibilities:**  
- **Design and develop Android applications:** Create new features, improve existing ones, and maintain Android app code.  
- **Collaborate with the design and development team:** Work closely with other teams to implement new features and optimize the user experience.  
- **Fix bugs and optimize application performance:** Ensure that applications are fast, responsive, and error-free.  
- **Write clean, scalable, and maintainable code:** Ensure the code is high-quality, easy to read, and manageable in the long term.  
- **Actively participate in code reviews and share knowledge with the team:** Contribute to code reviews and exchange best practices to improve teamwork.  

**Requirements:**  
- At least 5 years of experience in Android development.  
- Excellent knowledge of Java and Kotlin.  
- Familiarity with the Android development environment (Android Studio), code versioning (Git), and debugging applications.  
- Knowledge of RESTful APIs and backend integration: Experience interacting with external services through RESTful APIs to exchange data with servers.  
- Ability to work in a team and manage tasks independently: Strong skills in collaborative teamwork as well as independently managing projects.  

**Why choose ALTEN?**  

**Technological challenges**  
We believe technology has great potential to improve our future, which is why we seek talents motivated to build the world of tomorrow today. With our client portfolio and various active R&D projects, at ALTEN, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects. Our Technical Direction will guide and support you throughout your journey. You will have the chance to challenge yourself in diverse project contexts and interact with industry experts to continuously expand your knowledge. You can combine your passions and take on professional challenges. Are you ready to accept the challenge?  

**Inspiring Togetherness**  
We are committed to fostering a serene and collaborative work environment by organizing team-building activities, social initiatives, and sports events to get to know each other better and share moments together. The success of a group is based on cooperation and mutual sharing of knowledge and interests.  

**Fulfilling Opportunities**  
At ALTEN, you will find cutting-edge training courses to enhance your technological and linguistic skills! Through the ALTEN Academy, you can obtain certifications with some of the most important international frameworks, such as IREB®, ISTQB®, and others. Additionally, through Aula Streaming, you will have access to more transversal training courses related to soft skills and can choose from 12 foreign language courses.  

**Sustainable Commitment**  
We believe technology supports social development and environmental protection. In addition to collaborating on projects aimed at sustainability, we are committed to supporting causes we care deeply about, having collaborated and continuing to collaborate with organizations such as AISM, AIRC, LILT, Save the Children, Treedom, and This Unique. We value uniqueness and are committed to ensuring that all our people have equal opportunities within our company, providing them with the tools to fully express their potential. Our approach to diversity and inclusion is based on principles of ethics and integrity and represents the key factor for developing broader horizons of personal and corporate growth. We promote the inclusion and integration of individuals belonging to protected categories, as regulated by Law 68/99.  

**Next Steps**  
Once we receive your CV, we will take the necessary time to evaluate it carefully.  

If it aligns with this or other open positions within the Group, our Talent Acquisition team will contact you by phone.  

The selection process will continue with an introductory interview with the Business area, followed by a more in-depth interview, during which a practical test may be requested, and finally, a technical interview.  

The order and number of interviews may vary depending on selection needs.  

Alternatively, we will be happy to keep your CV in our database to reassess it for future opportunities. Operating in 12 different cities and as many sectors, you may be contacted by multiple Talent Acquisition Partners and/or Business Managers if they believe your profile aligns with the projects and needs they are seeking at that time.  

If you identify additional offers of interest and aligned with your profile, we look forward to your application so we can evaluate it again.  

ALTEN operates in compliance with the principles of diversity, equity, and inclusion, which fuel our values. ALTEN aims to break down all barriers and prejudices, ensuring an accessible and welcoming work environment, evaluating applications regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability (Articles 1 and 18, Law 68/99), age, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, personal and political beliefs, union membership, family responsibilities, and socio-economic background.

OUR OFFER\r\n\r\nIn Capgemini Engineerin:
**OUR OFFER**  

At Capgemini Engineering, a global leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unlock their potential. From autonomous vehicles to life-saving robots, our talents in digital technology and software think outside the box, offering unique R&D and engineering services across all industries.  

Join us for a career full of opportunities, where you can make a difference and where no two days are the same.  

**YOUR ROLE**  

Capgemini Engineering is looking for an Android Developer in Rome with the following technical skills:  
- Drive continuous improvement and continuous delivery in our software development process within an agile development team.  
- Write automated unit, system, and acceptance tests as appropriate to support our continuous integration pipelines.  
- Translate functional specifications into logical, component-based technical designs.  
- 2+ years of experience working in an Android environment.  
- 2+ years of experience developing features in Java or Kotlin.  
- Knowledge of API service connection paradigms.  
- Understanding of client/server architectures.  
- Understanding of mobile development best practices.  
- The desire to pick up, learn, and work with new technologies and frameworks such as Jetpack Compose and GraphQL.  
- Demonstrates familiarity with associated technologies within their specialization as part of the wider ecosystem, e.g., CI/CD, Git, GitHub Actions.  

**WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE**  
- We recognize the importance of flexible working arrangements to provide concrete support to our employees: whether it’s remote work or flexible working hours, you’ll have an environment that allows you to maintain a healthy work-life balance.  
- At the heart of our mission is the growth of your career. Our professional development programs are designed to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.  
- We are committed to fostering the development of our employees’ potential, involving them directly in company life to motivate them to improve their performance, with opportunities to follow tailored training paths and obtain certifications in the latest technologies.  
- We are dedicated to improving our collective performance through our inclusive work environment, where diverse talents are valued. Diversity is an essential aspect of our corporate culture, broadening our horizons through dynamics related to experience, culture, ethnicity, corporate behavior, personality, and communication.  

**ABOUT CAPGEMINI GROUP**  

A global leader in Engineering and R&D services, Capgemini Engineering combines its deep knowledge of industrial sectors with cutting-edge digital and software technologies to support the convergence of the physical and digital worlds. Benefiting from the expertise of the broader Group, it helps clients accelerate their journey toward the Intelligent Industry.  

Capgemini Engineering has over 55,000 team members, including engineers and scientists, in more than 30 countries worldwide, with expertise in various sectors, including Aeronautics, Space, Defense, Naval, Automotive, Rail, Infrastructure & Transportation, Energy, Utilities & Chemicals, Life Sciences, Communications, Semiconductor & Electronics, Industrial & Consumer, Software & Internet.  

Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of the Capgemini Group, a global partner for business and technology transformation. It supports its clients in their transition toward a more digital and sustainable world, creating a positive impact for businesses and society. Capgemini is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 people present in over 50 countries worldwide. With more than 55 years of experience, Capgemini is a trusted partner for its clients, providing innovative solutions for their business needs. Capgemini offers end-to-end services and solutions, from strategy and design to engineering, leveraging its cutting-edge expertise in AI, cloud, and data, its industry experience, and its ecosystem of partners. In 2023, the Group recorded total revenues of €22.5 billion.

Would you like to work as an "Android Developer" in the IT Department of BNL?

Joining BNL, part of the BNP Paribas Group, means working for one of the leading Italian banks, which is part of an international group that is a European leader in banking and financial services, present in more than 64 countries with approximately 184,000 employees. This means working in a challenging environment with an international culture strongly oriented toward innovation.

### What does the Digital Channel - Design & Development structure do?

The mission of the tribe is to manage the evolution and maintenance of the Bank's Digital Channels, CRM applications, and to industrially develop Digital capabilities to support the various Customer Journeys of clients.

### What will you do specifically?

You will actively participate in the Quality & Maintenance activities of the Tribe, which aims to:
- Ensure the operation of applications
- Improve the quality of assets and related services offered to customers
- Ensure alignment in managing IT Production and Security activities

In particular, you will provide second-level support, interacting with and guiding support teams, effectively managing maintenance tickets within defined SLAs, and applying the classification of maintenance tickets to drive continuous improvement actions for automated processes.

You will analyze application issues in production and assess business needs to evolve existing applications and processes; design and develop new applications or parts of them when required, as well as collaborate in analyzing new technological solutions.

### The Ideal Candidate
- Has strong problem-solving skills
- Works well in a collaborative team environment and has good communication skills
- Is skilled in managing anomalies by involving and actively coordinating the various stakeholders needed for ticket analysis and problem resolution
- Is adept at synthesis and simplification
- Organizes activities by priority and easily manages unexpected events

### The Ideal Candidate Knows:
- Kotlin
- Jetpack Compose
- Android Studio
- Android SDK
- MVVM and Design Patterns
- Experience in developing and maintaining libraries
- Libraries and frameworks such as Koin, Espresso, and Okhttp
- Familiarity with RESTful APIs for connecting Android applications to back-end services
- English language (B2 level)

### Additionally, Preferred Experience In:
- Splunk
- Kubernetes
- Hibernate
- Junit
- Data: SQLite and Room
- DevOps: Jenkins, Maven, Nexus, SonarQube
- Knowledge of cloud architectures, microservices, containers, etc.
- Knowledge of web architectures, client/server applications, API services
- DevOps processes and continuous integration
- GIT and the GitFlow process

### The Ideal Candidate's Background:
- Holds a degree in STEM disciplines or equivalent experience
- Has at least three to five years of experience in analysis and development, with three years of experience in designing and developing native mobile applications
- Is familiar with major IT Enterprise architectures and fundamental principles
- Has knowledge of and/or has worked with Agile methodology

### WORK LOCATION
Rome, in a hybrid mode

### DURATION AND COMPENSATION
The contract offered is permanent. Compensation is in line with the National Collective Credit Agreement and is commensurate with the level of experience.

In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are fundamental values. BNP Paribas offers equal employment opportunities to all qualified candidates and is actively committed to ensuring an inclusive work environment where all diversities are valued. Together, we build the bank of tomorrow: innovative, responsible, and sustainable.

**Job Description**  
Do you want to be part of a team that develops Home Credit's key application? We are looking for an enthusiastic iOS developer to join our mobile app team. If you're ready for new challenges and want to contribute your experience and ideas, you're in the right place!  

**What will you do?**  
- Take responsibility for the development of our key Home Credit mobile application.  
- Spend approximately 30% of your time on refactoring existing code, with the remaining time dedicated to developing new features.  
- Participate in the creation and development of the app's internal architecture.  
- Be responsible for selecting the appropriate tools and libraries needed for the app's implementation.  
- Work with the following technology stack: Swift, UIKit, ReactiveKit, Bond, Alamofire, Moya, Fastlane, GitLab.  

**What are we looking for?**  
- Experience in iOS development: At least 2 years of proven experience (developing software applications based on requirements, quality control, collaboration with stakeholders on analysis, production environment support, contributing to methodologies and workflows, etc.).  
- Practical knowledge of Swift and UIKit: Knowledge of ReactiveKit and reactive programming is an advantage, but if you lack sufficient knowledge, we will teach you.  
- Familiarity with version control and ticketing tools: We use Git and Jira.  
- Passion and enthusiasm for learning new things: You follow the latest trends and enjoy challenges. You are motivated to improve and find better ways to do things.

- 50% Developing the app's internal architecture

**Benefits**

**About the Project**  
**IT Development & Operations at Home Credit**  

**Industry**  
Financial Services and Investments  

**Team Size**  
16+ people  

**Relocation**  
No  

**Location**  
Nové sady, Brno  

**About the IT Teams**  
The IT teams at Home Credit work closely together. We handle development, operations, and security, including:  
- Operations and user support, helpdesk and monitoring, database management, and data lines.  
- Development of database applications, frontend applications, and mobile applications.  
- Security.  

**Development**  
We know our clients best, so we develop our main information system, Homer, and our mobile application entirely in-house.  

Homer is a robust system with several dozen modules. We work in smaller teams, each responsible for a specific part. Some teams specialize purely in back-end development, while others focus on web and online services for our clients.  

The mobile application is relatively new and still evolving. It is managed by two development teams, along with an internal UX designer.  

We operate as an agile IT team, currently planning in 2-week sprints and releasing new system versions on a monthly basis. We use automation, DevOps, and are moving towards delivering new solutions through a microservices architecture.  

We work on both new functionalities and redesigning existing solutions. Code quality is important to us, and we regularly review it through code reviews.  

We value collaboration and responsibility. When everything works as it should, we can be very flexible.  

**Operations**  
Our Operations team manages servers and storage arrays, takes care of network infrastructure, and handles data lines.
Gratulujeme, právě jste prošli prvním ko:
**English Translation:**

**Congratulations, you’ve just passed the first round, because most people wouldn’t even click on such a headline. Let’s break it down so you can learn as much as possible about your future.**

**Android** – As you probably understand, we’re not looking for a robot but a real person who knows the Android platform and is familiar with mobile app development.

**Developer** – To create a successful app, it’s not enough to just play games on your phone. We’ll definitely appreciate that you’re skilled in programming and that Java doesn’t surprise you.

**Which** – A pronoun. Without it, the sentence doesn’t make sense.

**Interested** – An important word, because you’ll become part of a team of tech enthusiasts, and you’ll definitely feel better if you enjoy tackling current IT trends, sharing your knowledge with others, and learning from each other.

**Internet of Things** – This is what sets us apart from regular companies. We don’t just develop software but also smart hardware. So, in addition to ridiculously large monitors, you’ll also come across 3D printers, smart scooters, lawnmowers, pumps, or even animal tracking devices.

As a mobile app developer, you’ll work with colleagues not only to ensure the app works on its own but also that the connected device does what it’s supposed to do. (It sounds straightforward, but you’d be surprised what happens when a robotic lawnmower rebels in the office.)

Can you already see yourself on our team? Read on to see what we can offer you.

**What can you look forward to?**

We do meaningful work and pride ourselves on an informal environment without unnecessary bureaucracy. Flexible working hours are standard for us, we accommodate remote work, and if someone gets sick, we don’t make a big deal out of it. It makes more sense to us than handing out ballet tickets. Most colleagues would trade them for Steam coupons anyway.

Forget about open spaces. We designed our offices on the border of Vinohrady and Vršovice ourselves to make them a great place to work. You’ll have peace and quiet to focus, as well as a space to relax and exchange ideas. The 3D printer is always on standby, the Volkswagen Caravelle is ready for you to borrow for a vacation, and we couldn’t do without quality fresh coffee. For lunch, you can choose from cuisines from all over the world in the area – from peaceful Asian spots to hipster bistros to solid Czech pubs. And there’s a park with ice cream just around the corner.

If you want to be part of a friendly team and work on truly interesting projects, get in touch with us. We’re looking forward to meeting you.

**More about the position**

**Required education:**  
Not important  

**Salary range:**  
90,000 to 120,000 CZK  

**Required languages:**  
Czech, English (intermediate)  

**Benefits:**  
Bonuses/performance rewards, laptop, flexible start/end of working hours, health leave/sick days, occasional remote work, company events, study leave options, shared car, English lessons  

**Type of employment:**  
Full-time  

**Length of employment:**  
Indefinite  

**Type of contract:**  
Employment contract, freelance/trade license, agreement on work activity  

**Address:**  
Na Královce 31/4, 10100 Prague - Vršovice, Czech Republic

### **Who are we? / About us**  
We are a tech development team made up of over 40 professionals committed to the quality of the software, products, and services we offer our clients.  

If you're looking for a project or team focused on software quality, best practices, a great work environment, and colleagues you can learn from, have fun with, and work alongside, you've found the perfect opportunity for you!  

You can find us at:  

### **Our team and culture / Our crew & culture**  
We all come from technological backgrounds, so we are used to working with agile and asynchronous methodologies, enjoying the freedom and flexibility that comes with them.  

We work remotely from different parts of the country, but we strongly foster our culture through daily meetings (with some fun “ruins” included), random coffee chats, talks, training sessions, in-person events, and let’s not even get started on our Discord channels...  

In short, at Secture, we take great care of our team, environment, and culture. Therefore, we are looking for colleagues who seek the same values that we actively promote.  

### **What will you be doing in this position?**  

#### **First month | Onboarding**  
We’ll sit down with you to explain the business, introduce you to the team, show you how we work, the tools we use, and provide everything you need during your first days with us.  

Our tech team will walk you through our stack, introduce you to all team members, and provide all the context necessary to understand the project and the environment you’ll be working in.  

You’ll likely join in the middle of a sprint. We start every day with a relaxed company-wide daily meeting at 10 a.m. to briefly share how each of us is progressing in our projects. Afterward, each team attends its own daily meetings.  

During this first month, both your development teammates and our project managers will support you with everything you need for the project you’ll be working on.  

We primarily communicate via Discord, document in Drive and Notion, and use Google Meet for meetings. Depending on the project, we also work with Monday, Trello, and Jira.  

#### **In the following months**  
As you become more familiar with the project, team, and stack, you’ll help estimate tasks and developments that will assist in prioritizing the project backlog.  

Some sprints will include improvement tasks to optimize performance, refactor code, eliminate legacy systems, avoid bottlenecks, and ultimately improve scalability for the future.  

We actively encourage our team members to share proposals and ideas without fear, whether they are improvements to existing developments or new features that could positively impact the projects you’ll be working on.  

As mentioned earlier, we value teamwork, good communication, software quality, and best practices.  

At Secture, we’re constantly growing, so we want you to become a key part of the team and help us continue building our projects, team, and culture.  

### **What do we expect from you?**  
- At least 4 years of experience as an iOS developer in product teams and agile environments.  
- Solid experience with:  
  - Swift + UI Kit  
  - Knowledge of VIPER and MVC architecture  
  - Firebase, managing test versions through the platform  
- **Extra points for:**  
  - Publishing apps on the App Store  
  - Experience with in-app purchases, store management, and its products (subscriptions and consumables)  
- Motivation, enthusiasm, and teamwork.  
- You’ll work on a very exciting project with opportunities for internal growth.  
- Enjoy working remotely and being accustomed to fluid communication through our internal company channels.  
- Ability to work in a team and help colleagues when needed.  
- Experience working closely with development and product teams, following best practices and agile methodologies.  
- Looking for a project focused on software quality, product quality, and team quality.
